graviscae: <entryFree id="n19938" type="main" key="Gra^viscae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grăviscae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grăvisca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to the territory of Tarquinii</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Le Saline</hi> or <hi rend="ital">S. Clementino</hi>, on the river <hi rend="ital">Marta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:475" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 475</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19938.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grăviscā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Graviscœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Graviscan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 67</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grăviscāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Graviscœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Graviscans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 407, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gravisonus: <entryFree id="n19939" type="main" key="gra^vi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gravis-sonus</etym>, <sense id="n19939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a deep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heavy sound</hi>, as defin. of sonorus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gravitas: <entryFree id="n19940" type="main" key="gra^vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gravis</etym>, <sense id="n19940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heaviness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19940.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus ejus (terrae) partibus in medium vergentibus nihil interrumpat, quo labefactari possit tanta contentio gravitatis et ponderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per inane moveri gravitate et pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 11, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1054" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1054</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: cuncta necesse est Aut gravitate sua ferri primordia rerum, Aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros propter gravitatem armorum, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum etiam gravitate et tarditate navium impediebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignava nequeunt gravitate moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:821" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 821</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me mea defendit gravitas (corresp. to moles and pondus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19940.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19940.3" n="1" level="3"> Of smell, <hi rend="ital">rankness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offensiveness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetidness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorundam odorum suavitati gravitas inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 18, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibusdam vocatur cynozolon propter gravitatem odoris (shortly before: odore gravissimo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 9, 35, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">halitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 6, 15, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 12, 51, § 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19940.4" n="2" level="3"> Of bodily condition, health, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwholesomeness; heaviness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faintness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sickness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore vix sustineo gravitatem hujus caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli aquarumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 34, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 26, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressus gravitate soporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:618" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 618</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an quod corporis gravitatem et dolorem animo judicamus, animi morbum corpore non sentimus?</quote> <trans><tr>painful</tr>, <tr>diseased condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit> Kühn.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 478</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 105, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 11, 44, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">auditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 42, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 48, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris et dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19940.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pressure</hi> of price, <hi rend="ital">dearness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19940.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The burden</hi> of pregnancy: <cit><quote lang="la">tendebat gravitas uterum mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 287</bibl></cit> (cf. onus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:504" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 504</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n19940.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19940.8" n="A" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">heaviness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudere gravitate linguae sonoque vocis agresti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: injuria gravitate tutior est, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruelty</hi>, Sall. Orat. Licin. (Hist. Fragm. 3, 22 Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fessi diuturnitate et gravitate belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: crudelitatem quoque <cb n="GRAV" /> gravitati addidit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 45, 13</bibl> Weissenb. —</sense><sense id="n19940.9" n="B" level="2"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seriousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gravity</hi> (syn.: magnitudo, dignitas, auctoritas, pondus): hos cum Suevi propter amplitudinem gravitatemque civitatis finibus expellere non potuissent, <hi rend="ital">importance</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">power</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium sententiarum gravitate, omnium verborum ponderibus est utendum,</quote> <trans><tr>importance</tr>, <tr>weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hoc sermonum positum in hominum veterum auctoritate plus videtur habere gravitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta illa, di immortales, fuit gravitas! quanta in oratione majestas!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitia et in omni re severitas habet illa quidem gravitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">erat in illo viro comitate condita gravitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitate mixtus lepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud me praeclare admones, cum illum videro, ne nimis indulgenter et ut cum gravitate potius loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de virtute et gravitate Caesaris, quam in summo dolore adhibuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae gravitatem intuentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego has partes lenitatis et misericordiae semper egi libenter: illam vero gravitatis severitatisque personam non appetivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec genera dicendi in senibus gravitatem non habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:326" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 326</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas quam vultus gravitasque oris prae se ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(senarius) quantum accipit celeritatis, tantum gravitatis amittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:140" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graviter: <entryFree id="n19941" type="main" key="gra^vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gravis <sense id="n19941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gravitudo: <entryFree id="n19942" type="main" key="gra^vi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gravis</etym>, <sense id="n19942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cold in the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catarrh</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sine ructu et gravitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:3:6:76" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 3, 6, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arterica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
graviusculus: <entryFree id="n19943" type="hapax" key="gra^vi^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n19943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [gravis, I. B. 1.], of tones, <hi rend="ital">rather deep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gravo: <entryFree id="n19944" type="main" key="gra^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>gravis</etym>. <sense id="n19944.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To charge with a load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppress</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n19944.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectum castrorum sarcinis gravant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus Actora magno Ense gravat Capaneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:257" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est ingenii cymba gravanda tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 22: <cit><quote lang="la">aegraque furtivum membra gravabat onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravantur arbores fetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 253</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt poma gravantia ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 812</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, si demissior ibis, Unda gravet pennas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:205" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia pondus illis abest, nec sese ipsi gravant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomacho inutilis, nervis inimicus, caput gravans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 75, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minui quod gravet (corpus) quolibet modo utilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 53, 119, § 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne obsidio ipsa multitudine gravaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:8" default="NO">38, 10, 8</bibl>; so in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia die febre commotus est: tertia cum se gravari videret,</quote> <trans><tr>weighed down</tr>, <tr>oppressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. 12</bibl></cit>; and esp. in <hi rend="ital">perf. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravatus somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 51, 70, § 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 1, 4, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:27" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 1, 6, § 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrietate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino somnoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19944.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to make pregnant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:614" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravatam esse virginem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 44, 1</bibl>; cf.: semper gravata lentiscus, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 9, 16; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=95:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 95, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19944.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19944.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incommode</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil moror officium, quod me gravat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem milia hominum, quos et ipse gravari militia senserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed magis hoc, quo (mala nostra) sunt cognitiora, gravant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 28</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n19944.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make more grievous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aggravate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu fortunam parce gravare meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:11:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo gravaret invidiam matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injusto faenore gravatum aes alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19944.6" n="D" level="2"> To lower in tone; hence, gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to give the grave accent</hi> to a vowel (opp. acuo): <cit><quote lang="la">a littera gravatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 539, 573</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n19944.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as <hi rend="ital">v. dep.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (lit., to be burdened with any thing, to feel burdened; hence), <hi rend="ital">to feel incommoded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wearied</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">annoyed</hi> at any thing; <hi rend="ital">to take amiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear with reluctance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to regard as a burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do unwillingly</hi> (class.); in Cic. only <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, afterwards also constr. with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n19944.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non gravabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: quid <cb n="GREG" /> gravare? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam gravatus fuisti, non nocuit tamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gravare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo gravari coepit, quod invidiam atque offensionem timere dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:25:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 25, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero non gravarer si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec gravatus senex dicitur locutus esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille non gravatus, Primum, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem ac metum juxta gravatus Vitellius ictum venis intulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignus erga me ut siet: ne gravetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19944.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogo, ut ne graveris exaedificare id opus, quod instituisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne graventur, sua quoque ad eum postulata deferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod illi quoque gravati prius essent ad populandam Macedoniam exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi non gravabor reddere dilatae pugnae rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 38, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:12" default="NO">6, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n19944.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pegasus terrenum equitem gravatus Bellerophontem,</quote> <trans><tr>disdaining to bear</tr>, <tr>throwing off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at illum acerbum et sanguinarium necesse est graventur stipatores sui,</quote> <trans><tr>be weary of supporting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampla et operosa praetoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectum civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem ac metum juxta gravatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms: </sense><sense id="n19944.11" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvātē</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">with difficulty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reluctance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwillingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grudgingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non gravate respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 208</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. gratuito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:19:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 19, 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. benigne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canius contendit a Pythio ut venderet: gravate ille primo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum haud gravate venissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. (al. gravati): <cit><quote lang="la">concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 43, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus et plantas ad saviandum gravatius porrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad M. Caes. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad M. Caes. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n19944.12" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grăvanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with reluctance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwillingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reguli Gallorum haud gravanter venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 24, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. (al. gravate); <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gregalis: <entryFree id="n19945" type="main" key="gre^ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grĕgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>grex</etym>, <sense id="n19945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the herd</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flock.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19945.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19945.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">belonging to the same host</hi> or <hi rend="ital">multitude.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19945.3" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grĕ-gāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">comrades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos nihil sumus, gregalibus illis, quibus te plaudente vigebamus, amissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 253</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19945.4" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">of the common sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gregali sagulo amictus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a common soldier's</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:74" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gregarius: <entryFree id="n19946" type="main" key="gre^ga_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grĕgārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a flock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herd.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19946.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregariorum pastorum disciplinam repudiasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § 1.—</sense><sense id="n19946.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">of the common sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi> (most freq. in milit. lang.): milites, <hi rend="ital">common soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privates</hi>, in opp. to the officers: <cit><quote lang="la">id etiam gregarii milites faciunt inviti, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 30, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 38, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2</bibl>; and in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 34, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregariam militiam sortitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—Rarely beyond the milit. sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gregatim: <entryFree id="n19947" type="main" key="gre^ga_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grĕgātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in flocks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herds</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">swarms.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19947.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">haec facienda, si gregatim pecora laborant: illa deinceps, si singula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes rempublicam habent, consilia privatim ac duces gregatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti gregatim semper ingrediuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 15, 18, § 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19947.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in troops</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis cives Romanos gregatim conjectos in lautumias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:57:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 57, § 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidit, ut nova contra genera morborum gregatim sentirentur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>among the common people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grego: <entryFree id="n19948" type="main" key="gre^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grĕgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to collect into a flock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gather into a host</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to collect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assemble</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and only postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Levitas ad se gregavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idaliae volucres caeloque domoque gregatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 17, 200</bibl></cit>: solus qui caedibus hausi Quinquaginta animas: totidem<pb n="830" /> <cb n="GREX" />  totidemque gregati Ferte manus, <hi rend="ital">all together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:668" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 668</bibl> (al. gregatim).</sense></entryFree>
gremialis: <entryFree id="n19949" type="main" key="gre^mi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grĕmĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gremium</etym>, <sense id="n19949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">growing in a cluster from the stump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si arbores caeduae fuerunt vel gremiales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:7:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 7, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gremium: <entryFree id="n19950" type="main" key="gre^mi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grĕmĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. garbh-as, child; cf. germen</etym>, <sense id="n19950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bosom</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. sinus). </sense><sense id="n19950.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gremium imbrem aureum (mittere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Juppiter) puer lactens Fortunae in gremio sedens, mammam appetens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:211" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 58, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:744 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 744 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiipse sui gnati minxerit in gremium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has dishonored his son's wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 30</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n19950.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra gremio mollito et subacto semen sparsum excipit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetolia medio fere Graeciae gremio continetur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the heart</tr>, <tr>centre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:37:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 37, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gremio Thebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:678" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e gremio Capuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 204</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Padus gremio Vesuli montis profluens,</quote> <trans><tr>from the bowels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:192" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusso in mediam curiam togae gremio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt, o carnifex, in gremio sepulta consulatus tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstrahi e sinu gremioque patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fratris gremio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque mihi fortuna fidesque est, In vestris pono gremiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingamus igitur Alexandrum dari nobis impositum gremio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>under our guidance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:1" default="NO">1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO">2, 4, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 5, 5: quis gremio Enceladi affert quantum meruit labor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:215" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 215</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gressio: <entryFree id="n19951" type="hapax" key="gressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gradior</etym>, <sense id="n19951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stepping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pace</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gressus: <entryFree id="n19952" type="main" key="gressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from gradior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19953" type="main" key="gressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gradior</etym>, <sense id="n19953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stepping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going</hi>, <hi rend="ital">step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">way.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19953.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus, passus, incessus, ingressus): tendere gressum ad moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 410</bibl></cit>; so in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 389</bibl>; 11, 29.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressus glomerare superbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 360</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:183" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 12, 12, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:10" default="NO">11, 13, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19953.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19953.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the <hi rend="ital">course</hi> of a vessel: <cit><quote lang="la">huc dirige gressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19953.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pace</hi>, as a measure of length, Gromat. Vet. p. 373, 9.</sense></entryFree>
grex: <entryFree id="n19954" type="main" key="grex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grex</orth>, <itype>grĕgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n19954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 72</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 662</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Maff. Mus. Veron. 127, 4) [Sanscr. root jar-, come together; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)gei/rw, a)gora/</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">a flock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarm</hi> (cf.: armentum, jumentum, pecus). </sense><sense id="n19954.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes dispulsae sui generis sequuntur greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">greges armentorum reliquique pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilissimarum equarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:7:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanigeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir gregis ipse caper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dux gregis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a bull</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anserum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—Opp. to armenta, of small cattle: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego sum pastor, non hic armenta gregesve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 513</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 635</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 28</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">grex totus in agris Unius scabie cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 79</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n19954.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n19954.3" n="A" level="2"> Of a number of persons, in a good or bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">society</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19954.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hunc igitur gregem P. Sullam ex his honestissimorum hominum gregibus reicietis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scribe tui gregis hunc,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>receive him into the number of your friends</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille virorum (of the Fabians),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:58" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cethegus libertos suos orabat, uti grege facto cum telis ad se irrumperent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in a body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 58, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos respexit rex grege facto venientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne servi quidem uno grege profugiunt dominos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>all together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego forsitan propter multitudinem patronorum in grege annumerer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicuri de grege porcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex contaminatus turpium virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indocilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:37" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum populum gregibus comitum premit spoliator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19954.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of players or charioteers, <hi rend="ital">a company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>: si voltis adplaudere hunc gregem<cb n="GRUN" />  et fabulam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. prol. 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1024, 5</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Marin. Frat. Arv. p. 257.—</sense><sense id="n19954.6" n="B" level="2"> Of things (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">virgarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a bundle of rods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grias: <entryFree id="n19955" type="main" key="gri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gricenea: <entryFree id="n19956" type="gloss" key="gricenea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gricenea</orth> <itype>funis crassus</itype>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=99:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 99, 4</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
grinnes: <entryFree id="n19957" type="main" key="Grinnes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grinnes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Gallia Belgica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the modern Druten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Warich and Bochstein</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
griphus: <entryFree id="n19958" type="greek" key="gri_phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grīphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gri=fos</foreign> (a net; hence transf.), <sense id="n19958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intricate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">puzzling question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a riddle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enigma</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">griphos dissolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
groco: <entryFree id="n19959" type="main" key="groco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">groco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n19959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to croak</hi> as a raven, Apul. de Deo Soc. prol. p. 366, 19 (Hild. crocare).</sense></entryFree>
groma: <entryFree id="n19960" type="main" key="gro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grōma</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">grūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n19960.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surveyor's pole</hi> or <hi rend="ital">measuring-rod</hi>, acc. to Paul. ex Fest. s. v. p. 72 Müll. and <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 63, 6</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n19960.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the centre of a camp</hi>, where the measuring-rod was planted, so as to divide the camp into four quarters by streets meeting at that point, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Limit. p. 164" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Limit. p. 164</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
gromaticus: <entryFree id="n19961" type="main" key="gro_ma_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grōmātĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">grūm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>groma</etym>, <sense id="n19961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to field-surveying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">castrametation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19961.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19961.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">grōmā-tĭca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">grūm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the art of field-surveying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">castrametation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 3, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19961.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">grōmātĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">writers on field-surveying</hi>, Hyg. de Mun. Castr. § 12.</sense></entryFree>
gromphaena: <entryFree id="n19962" type="main" key="gromphaena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gromphaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of amaranth</hi>: Amaranthus tricolor, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 23, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gromphena: <entryFree id="n19963" type="main" key="gromphe_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gromphēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Sardinian bird of the crane species</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 52, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grosa: <entryFree id="n19964" type="main" key="grosa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grosa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tool of a silversmith</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grosphus: <entryFree id="n19965" type="greek" key="grosphus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grosphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gro/sfos</foreign>, <sense id="n19965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the point of a javelin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19966" type="main" key="Grosphus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grosphus</orth>, <sense id="n19966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16</bibl> <hi rend="ital">lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
grossitudo: <entryFree id="n19967" type="main" key="grossi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grossĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. grossus</etym>, <sense id="n19967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickness</hi>=crassitudo (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:52:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 52, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, Reg. 7, 26; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grossulus: <entryFree id="n19968" type="main" key="grossu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grossŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. grossus</etym>, <sense id="n19968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small unripe fig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 10</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grossus: <entryFree id="n19969" type="main" key="grossus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grossus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n19969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unripe fig</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:254" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 27, 43, § 254</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19970" type="main" key="grossus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindred with crassus</etym>, <sense id="n19970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thick</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 10, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis grossior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dal. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:41:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 41, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1</bibl> Reg. 12, 10; 2 Chron. 10, 10.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 29, 12</bibl>; cf.: grossus <foreign lang="greek">paxu/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gros-sĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">more roughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">definire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Duab. Anim. 11:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Duab. Anim. 11, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grudii: <entryFree id="n19971" type="main" key="Grudi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grudĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Belgica, now <hi rend="ital">Groede</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Gronde</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gruis: <entryFree id="n19972" type="main" key="gruis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gruis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. grus.</entryFree>
grullus: <entryFree id="n19973" type="gloss" key="grullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grullus</orth> <foreign lang="greek">ei)=dos ploi/ou</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
gruma: <entryFree id="n19974" type="main" key="gru_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grūma</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">grūmātĭcus</orth>, v. grom-.</entryFree>
grumentum: <entryFree id="n19975" type="main" key="Grumentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grumentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n19975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Lucania</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Saponara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 37, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 41, 1</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19975.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grumentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Grumentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grumulus: <entryFree id="n19976" type="main" key="gru_mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grūmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>grumus</etym>, <sense id="n19976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little hill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hillock</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6</bibl>; Ambros. de Elia, 6, 18.</sense></entryFree>
grumus: <entryFree id="n19977" type="main" key="gru_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grūmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little heap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hillock</hi> of earth: grumus terrae collectio minor tumulo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll.; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 15, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 3</bibl>; Auct. B. Hisp. 24.</sense></entryFree>
grunda: <entryFree id="n19978" type="gloss" key="grunda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grunda</orth> <foreign lang="greek">ste/gh kai\ to\ u(pe\r to\n pulew=na e)ce/xon, u(po/stegon</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
grundiles: <entryFree id="n19979" type="main" key="Grundi_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grundīles</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grundūles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n19979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of the Lares</hi>, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 379</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grunium: <entryFree id="n19980" type="main" key="Gru_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grūnĭum</orth>, v. Grynium.</entryFree>
grunnio: <entryFree id="n19981" type="main" key="grunni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grunnĭo</orth> (also ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">grundio</orth>), <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n19981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grunt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19981.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, said of swine: grunnit tepido lacte satur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 27</bibl>: grunnientem aspexi <cb n="GUBE" /> scrofam, <bibl default="NO"><author>Laber.</author> ib. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apion maximum piscium esse tradit porcum: grunnire eum, cum capiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 9, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 22</bibl>: grundibat graviter pecus suillum, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 379</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n19981.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other creatures: agni grundibant, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 465, 1</bibl>: cruento ita ore grundibat miser, Caecil. ib. (Com. Fragm. v. 103 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
grunnitus: <entryFree id="n19982" type="main" key="grunni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grunnītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>grunnio</etym>, <sense id="n19982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grunting</hi> of swine: <cit><quote lang="la">aut grunnitum (audiunt), cum jugulatur, suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gruo: <entryFree id="n19983" type="main" key="gru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>grus</etym>, the note of the crane, <sense id="n19983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crunkle</hi>: gruere dicuntur grues, ut sues grunnire, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=97" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 97</bibl>: grus gruit, Auct. Carm. de Philom. 23.</sense></entryFree>
grus: <entryFree id="n19984" type="main" key="grus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grus</orth>, <itype>grŭis</itype> (also in the <sense id="n19984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">gruis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 8, 7</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 87</bibl>) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ge/ranos</foreign>, akin to <foreign lang="greek">ge/rwn</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">a crane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 30, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:75" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 181</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">regarded by the Romans as a delicacy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19984.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (with reference to the form of a crane's bill), <hi rend="ital">a besieging machine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">battering-ram</hi>, called also corvus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gry: <entryFree id="n19985" type="greek" key="gry"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gry</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">gru=</foreign>, <sense id="n19985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the least trifle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gry quidem ferre hinc potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 67</bibl></cit> Weise (recent edd. write <foreign lang="greek">gru=</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
gryllo: <entryFree id="n19986" type="main" key="gryllo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gryllo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>gryllus</etym>, the note of the cricket, <sense id="n19986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chirp</hi>: et gryllus gryllat, Auct. Carm. de Philom. 62.</sense></entryFree>
gryllus: <entryFree id="n19987" type="greek" key="gryllus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gryllus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">grillus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gru/llos</foreign>. <sense id="n19987.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cricket</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grasshopper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 138</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19987.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in painting, <hi rend="ital">a kind of comic figures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n19988" type="greek" key="Gryllus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gryllus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">*gru/llos</foreign>, <sense id="n19988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n19988.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Xenophon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fell in the battle at Mantinea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was celebrated by Aristotle in a monogram entitled</hi> <foreign lang="greek">*gru/llos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n19988.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:60:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 60, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:14:13" default="NO">2, 14, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
grynia: <entryFree id="n19989" type="main" key="Gry_ni_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Grȳnīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grȳnĭum</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grūnium</orth> in some editt. of Nep.), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gru/neia</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*gru/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n19989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Æolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a temple of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:59" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 6, 21, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 9, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n19989.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Grȳnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gru/neios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Grynia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Grynian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gryps: <entryFree id="n19990" type="greek" key="gryps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gryps</orth>, <itype>gryphis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">grȳphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:2" default="NO">3, 7, 2</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gru/y</foreign>, <sense id="n19990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous fourfooted bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a griffin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pegasos equino capite volucres et gryphas auritos aduncitate rostri fabulosos reor, illos in Scythia, hos in Aethiopia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 70, § 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 22, 66</bibl> and 67.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jungentur jam grypes equis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the impossible shall happen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
grypus: <entryFree id="n19991" type="greek" key="gry_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">grȳpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grupo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n19991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hook-nosed</hi>, as a surname: <cit><quote lang="la">alter, cui propter nasi magnitudinem cognomen Grypo fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:section=9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 1, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
guber: <entryFree id="n19992" type="gloss" key="guber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">guber</orth> <foreign lang="greek">kubernh/ths</foreign>, Gloss. Graec. Lat.</entryFree>
gubernabilis: <entryFree id="n19993" type="main" key="gu^berna_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭbernābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>guberno</etym>, <sense id="n19993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">susceptible of being governed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">controllable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive anima est mundus sive corpus natura gubernabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:29:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gubernaculum: <entryFree id="n19994" type="main" key="gu^berna_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭbernācŭlum</orth> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭ-bernāclum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:904" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 904</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 176</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">859</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 349 al.</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>guberno</etym>, <sense id="n19994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudder</hi> (cf. clavus). </sense><sense id="n19994.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis, non sapientis inventa sunt navigia, additis a tergo gubernaculis, quae huc atque illuc cursum navigii torqueant: exemplum a piscibus tractum, qui cauda reguntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium meatus gubernaculi modo regunt (caudae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 50, 111, § 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cruribus velut gubernaculis demissis cursum dirigeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ille naufragus ad gubernaculum accessit, et navi, quoad potuit, est opitulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse gubernaclo rector subit, ipse magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n19994.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">guidance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direction;</hi> esp. of the state, <hi rend="ital">government</hi> (usually in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">clavum tanti imperii tenere et gubernacula rei publicae tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad gubernacula rei publicae sedere debebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repelli a gubernaculis civitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recedere a gubernaculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad gubernacula rei publicae accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: quis ad gubernacula sedeat summa cura <pb n="831" /> <cb n="GUGE" /> providendum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abicere gubernacula imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transferre ad aliquem fortunarum suarum gubernacula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Const. 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperare gubernacula vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 219</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rare) exercitus non habilis gubernaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:113:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 113, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernaculum rei publicae tenere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gubernatio: <entryFree id="n19995" type="main" key="gu^berna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭbernātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>guberno</etym>, <sense id="n19995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piloting of a ship</hi> (Ciceron.). </sense><sense id="n19995.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in ipsa gubernatione negligentia est navis eversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 24</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n19995.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">management</hi>, <hi rend="ital">government</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi imperii gubernatione districtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi consilii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 15, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gubernator: <entryFree id="n19996" type="main" key="gu^berna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭbernātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n19996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steersman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilot</hi> (cf.: magister, navarchus, nauclerus, navicularius). </sense><sense id="n19996.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu proreta isti navi's, ego gubernator ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernator clavum tenens sedet in puppi quietus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Inv. 1, 34, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 24</bibl>;
