<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:34" default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:61" default="NO">4, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 269</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 337</bibl> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillo quilibet gubernator est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n19996.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governor</hi>: cum in rebus animalibus aliud pro alio ponitur; <cit><quote lang="la">ut de agitatore (Ennius): Gubernator magna contorsit equum vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; the same, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 244</bibl> P. and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 451</bibl> ib. (Ann. v. 160 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">poli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>God</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 903" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 903</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodes gubernatoresque rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi tutor et procurator rei publicae: sic enim appelletur, quicumque erit rector et gubernator civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gubernatrix: <entryFree id="n19997" type="main" key="gu^berna_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭbernātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gubernator, II.</etym>, <sense id="n19997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conductress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an fortunam collaudem, quae gubernatrix fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista praeclara gubernatrice civitatum eloquentia rem publicam dissipaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gubernio: <entryFree id="n19998" type="main" key="gu^berni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭbernĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. gubernius <sense id="n19998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gubernius: <entryFree id="n19999" type="hapax" key="gu^berni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭbernĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>guberno</etym>, <sense id="n19999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steersman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilot</hi>, for the usual gubernator, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 10</bibl>.—Another form: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭ-bernĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
guberno: <entryFree id="n20000" type="greek" key="gu^berno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭberno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kubernw=</foreign>, <sense id="n20000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to steer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pilot a ship</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n20000.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: dum clavum rectum teneant navemque gubernent, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 472 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut si nautae certarent, quis eorum potissimum gubernaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillo mari gubernare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernare e terra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to guide those who are in peril while keeping in safety one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quilibet nautarum tranquillo mari gubernare potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. gubernator, I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n20000.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to direct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi> (a favorite word with Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moderor, rego): qui eos gubernat animus infirmum gerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid miramur L. Sullam, cum solus rem publicam regeret orbemque terrarum gubernaret? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">melius gubernari et regi civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; 3, 35; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: in gubernanda re publica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque hortor, ut omnia gubernes ac moderere prudentia tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa tormenta gubernat dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam petitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim ergo totum hoc ita gubernes, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec fortuna viderit, quoniam ratio non gubernat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec deus aliquis gubernabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae motum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter meum rei publicae et rerum urbanarum ratio gubernabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 127, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massyleum virga gubernet equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:23:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 23, 14</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: jam ex sermone hoc gubernabunt doctius porro, <hi rend="ital">will steer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">behave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 99</bibl>; cf. gubernator, II.</sense></entryFree>
gubernum: <entryFree id="n20001" type="main" key="gu^bernum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭbernum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>guberno</etym>, <sense id="n20001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rudder</hi> (ante-class. for the class. gubernaculum): proras despoliate et detondete guberna, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 553</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:439" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 439</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gugerni: <entryFree id="n20002" type="main" key="Gugerni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gugerni</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cug-</orth>, ap. Plin. Sillig.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gub-</orth>, Jan.), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Germany</hi>,<cb n="GURD" />  in the modern <hi rend="ital">Cleves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gula: <entryFree id="n20003" type="main" key="gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root gar, to swallow; Sanscr. gir-āmi; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">bor</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">bora/, bibrw/skw</foreign>; cf.: voro, gurges, glutio, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 470" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 470</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n20003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gullet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weasand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throat</hi> (cf.: faux, guttur, jugulum). </sense><sense id="n20003.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula nervo et carne constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 66, § 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:201" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 79, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:130" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 15, 80, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum it dormitum, follem sibi obstringit ob gulam, ne quid animae forte amittat dormiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi jam interstringam gulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem obtorta gula de convivio in vincula abripi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo gulam fregere,</quote> <trans><tr>the neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20003.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the palate</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">gluttony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gormandizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appetite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o gulam insulsam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidae neque salem neque alia irritamenta gulae quaerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil servile gulae parens habet,</quote> <trans><tr>a belly-god</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 111</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">profundam gulam alicujus explere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperare gulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intempestivae ac sordidae gulae homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenua gula,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>palate</tr>, <tr>taste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:11:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta est gula, quae sibi totos Ponit apros!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimus quis melior plorante gula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:158" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 158</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proceres gulae narrant,</quote> <trans><tr>gourmands</tr>, <tr>epicures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gulliocae: <entryFree id="n20004" type="gloss" key="gulliocae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gulliocae</orth> <itype>nucum juglandium summa et viridia putamina</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98</bibl> Müll.; Lucil. Fragm. inc. v. 164.</entryFree>
gulo: <entryFree id="n20005" type="main" key="gu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gula, II.; cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ingluvies, p. 112</etym>, <sense id="n20005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gormandizer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">epicure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glutton</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 295</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gulose: <entryFree id="n20006" type="main" key="gu^lo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭlōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. gulosus <sense id="n20006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gulositas: <entryFree id="n20007" type="main" key="gu^lo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭlōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gulosus</etym>, <sense id="n20007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gluttony</hi> (late Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Frat. Erem. Serm. 31" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Frat. Erem. Serm. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gulosus: <entryFree id="n20008" type="main" key="gu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gula, II.</etym>, <sense id="n20008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gluttonous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luxurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dainty</hi> (post-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">edax, vorax): oculis quoque gulosi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil est miserius nec gulosius Santra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gulosum Fictile,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>containing dainty food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:19" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstinentia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an abstinence that enhances enjoyment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 107, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: nimium lector gulosus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a too voracious reader</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">an over-fastidious reader</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:59:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 59, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭlōse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">gluttonously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gulosius condire cibos, Col. praef. § 5: nil est, Apici, tibi gulosius factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:22:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gulosissime nutrit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gulussa: <entryFree id="n20009" type="main" key="Gulussa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gulussa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gulūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Masinissa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
gumen: <entryFree id="n20010" type="main" key="gu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n20010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gum</hi>, post-class. for gummi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 7, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gumia: <entryFree id="n20011" type="main" key="gu^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gŭmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>com.</gen>, <sense id="n20011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gourmand</hi>: Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 118, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 311</bibl>; Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ingluvies, p. 112 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
gummatus: <entryFree id="n20012" type="main" key="gumma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gummātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gummi</etym>, <sense id="n20012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing gum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gummy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in cerasis et in omnibus gummatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
gummeus: <entryFree id="n20013" type="main" key="gumme^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gummĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing gum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gummy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">succina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 6, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gummi: <entryFree id="n20014" type="greek" key="gummi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gummi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cummi</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mis</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cummis</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">gummis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n20014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Graec. gummeos, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 225</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">ko/mmi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">gum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 45, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 1, 1, § 3 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:66" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 12, 26, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 16</bibl> et saep. (in Plin. cummi or cummis is the reading in the best MSS.).</sense></entryFree>
gummino: <entryFree id="n20015" type="hapax" key="gummi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gummĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n20015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to distil gum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gumminet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. germinet).</sense></entryFree>
gummitio: <entryFree id="n20016" type="hapax" key="gummi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gummītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>gummi</etym>, <sense id="n20016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a besmearing with gum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gummosus: <entryFree id="n20017" type="main" key="gummo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gummōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of gum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gummy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 9, 11, § 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:181 al" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 38, 72, § 181 al.</bibl> (in these passages the better reading is cumminosus).</sense></entryFree>
gummus: <entryFree id="n20018" type="main" key="gummus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gummus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = gummi, Gargil. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:de Pom. 16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> de Pom. 16</bibl>.</entryFree>
gurdonicus: <entryFree id="n20019" type="hapax" key="gurdo_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gurdōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gurdus</etym>, <sense id="n20019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doltish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gurdus: <entryFree id="n20020" type="foreign" key="gurdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gurdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Spanish</etym>, <sense id="n20020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jolterhead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">numskull</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurdos, quos pro stolidis accipit vulgus, ex Hispania duxisse originem audivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: gurdus lentus, inutilis, Gloss. Isid.; Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 8</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 13 Rib.). <cb n="GUST" /></sense></entryFree>
gurges: <entryFree id="n20021" type="main" key="gurges1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gurges</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>v. gula; and cf. <foreign lang="greek">ba/raqron</foreign>, vorago</etym>, <sense id="n20021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raging abyss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whirlpool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gulf</hi> (syn.: vorago, barathrum). </sense><sense id="n20021.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non Rheni fossam gurgitibus illis redundantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidus hic coeno vastaque voragine gurges Aestuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multamque trahens sub gurgite arenam Volturnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterno procurrens gurgite pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per medios gurgites (opp. vada),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deficientibus animis hauriebantur gurgitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caenosus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Styx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:266" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 266</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20021.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20021.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">waters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fessos jam gurgite Phoebus Ibero Tingat equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:913" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 913</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euboicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carpathius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atlanteus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:223" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tusci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurgite ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 310</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 704</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculeus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Atlantic</tr>, <tr>beyond Gibraltar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:280" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 280</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20021.4" n="B" level="2"> Of insatiable craving, <hi rend="ital">an abyss;</hi> of persons, <hi rend="ital">a spendthrift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui immensa aliqua vorago est, aut gurges vitiorum turpitudinumque omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias in profundissimum libidinum gurgitem profundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:43:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 43, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges ac vorago patrimonii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 111</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille gurges atque heluo, natus abdomini suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apicius, nepotum omnium altissimus gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 133</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20022" type="main" key="Gurges2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gurges</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20022.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Fabius, Q. F. M. N. Gurges, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20022.2" n="II" level="1"> Fabius Gurges, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:266" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 266</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20022.3" n="III" level="1"> C. Volcatius Gurges, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gurgito: <entryFree id="n20023" type="main" key="gurgi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gurgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>gurges</etym>, <sense id="n20023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to engulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino nimis gurgitati mentis oppressione torpescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 35, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gurgulio: <entryFree id="n20024" type="main" key="gurgu^li^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gurgŭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindred with glutio; v. gurges, gula</etym>, <sense id="n20024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gullet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weasand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">windpipe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hircus cervice et collo brevi, gurgatione longiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; Cic. Fragm. Or. pro Tullio, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Op. D. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic gurgulio est exercitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n20025" type="main" key="gurgu^li^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gurgŭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, collat. form of curculio, q. v.</entryFree>
gurgustidonii: <entryFree id="n20026" type="spur" key="Gurgusti^do_ni^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gurgustĭdōnĭi</orth>, vulg. lect. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 13</bibl>, inst. of Gorgonidonii, q. v.</entryFree>
gurgustiolum: <entryFree id="n20027" type="main" key="gurgusti^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gurgustĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>gurgusti. um</etym>, <sense id="n20027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shanty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112</bibl> and 147.</sense></entryFree>
gurgustium: <entryFree id="n20028" type="main" key="gurgusti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gurgustĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindred with gurgulio, perh. with reference to its straitness</etym>, <sense id="n20028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hovel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quo e gurgustio te prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gurgustio habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Bono Mort. 1, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
gustabilis: <entryFree id="n20029" type="main" key="gusta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gustābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gusto</etym>, <sense id="n20029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">appetizing</hi>, Ambros. de Noe, 15, 52.</sense></entryFree>
gustatio: <entryFree id="n20030" type="main" key="gusta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gustātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.; a first tasting of food; hence</etym>, <sense id="n20030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first light dish of a Roman meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an antepast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussi discubuimus, et gustatione mirifica initiati vino etiam Falerno inundamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gustator: <entryFree id="n20031" type="main" key="gusta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gustātor</orth>, <itype>oris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the taster</hi>: digitus, i. e. the forefinger, used in tasting (= <foreign lang="greek">da/ktulos lixano/s</foreign>), Hier. in. Isa. 11, 40, 12.</sense></entryFree>
gustatorium: <entryFree id="n20032" type="main" key="gusta_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gustātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the vessels containing an antepast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an antepast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whet</hi> (v. gustatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:88" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 88</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
gustatus: <entryFree id="n20033" type="main" key="gusta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gustātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> <etym>id.; a tasting of food; hence</etym>. <sense id="n20033.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The taste</hi>, as one of the five senses: <cit><quote lang="la">gustatus, qui sentire eorum, quibus vescimur, genera debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimaverim omnibus (animalibus) sensum et gustatus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 71, 91, § 196</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20033.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flavor</hi> of any thing. </sense><sense id="n20033.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">varietas pomorum eorumque jucundus non gustatus solum, sed odoratus etiam et aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(uva) primo est peracerba gustatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20033.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinosi verae laudis gustatum non habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gusto: <entryFree id="n20034" type="main" key="gusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>gustus</etym>, <sense id="n20034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take a little of</hi> any thing (freq. and class.; cf.: libo, manduco, edo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n20034.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20034.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum biduum ita jejunus fuissem, ut ne aquam quidem gustarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leporem et gallinam et anserem gustare fas non putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustatus sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 52</bibl></cit>: celerius panis mandendus quam vinum<pb n="832" /> <cb n="GUTT" />  gustandum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustare de potione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba subsalsa gustanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 29, 103, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alypon acre gustatu ac lentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:85" default="NO">14, 85</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">primis, ut dicitur, labris gustare physiologiam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to have a superficial knowledge of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20034.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to take a slight meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take a luncheon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whet; to eat a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cretes, quorum nemo gustavit umquam cubans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post solem plerumque frigida lavabatur, deinde gustabat, dormiebatque minimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20034.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partake of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustaras civilem sanguinem vel potius exsorbueras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustare partem ullam liquidae voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si ipsi haec neque attingere neque sensu nostro gustare possemus, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summatim rerum causas et genera ipsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metrodorum illum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>heard</tr>, <tr>attended for a while</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem aliquam rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem alicujus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>listen to</tr>, <tr>overhear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gustulum: <entryFree id="n20035" type="main" key="gustu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gustŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>gustus</etym>. <sense id="n20035.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small dish of food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 232</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20035.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kiss</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcem et amarum gustulum carpis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gustum: <entryFree id="n20036" type="hapax" key="gustum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. gustus, I. 2. a.</entryFree>
gustus: <entryFree id="n20037" type="main" key="gustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gustus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindred with Sanscr. ǵush, to be fond of; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">geu/w, geu/omai, geu=sis</foreign>, taste</etym>, <sense id="n20037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tasting</hi> of food, <hi rend="ital">a partaking slightly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eating a little</hi> of any thing (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.; cf.: gustatus, sapor). </sense><sense id="n20037.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20037.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">minister inferre epulas et explorare gustu solitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorare aliquid gustu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO">2, 2, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustu libata potio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille ad primum gustum concidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine crebro salis gustu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 32, § 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20037.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20037.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A light dish at the beginning of a Roman meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an antepast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relish</hi>, = gustatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:52:12" default="NO">11, 52, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustus elementa per omnia quaerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—Also in a <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">gustum versatile sic facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:5:section=181" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 5, § 181</bibl></cit> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n20037.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A draught of water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profer ex illa amphora gustum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20037.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flavor</hi>, = sapor (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">attrahatur spiritu is sucus, donec in ore gustus ejus sentiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:82" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 50, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:121" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 96, § 121</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n20037.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n20037.8" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. 2. a.) <hi rend="ital">A foretaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specimen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc gustum totum librum repromitto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expetens versificationis nostrae gustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustum tibi dare volui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20037.9" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">Taste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanitas significat sermonem praeferentem in verbis et sono et usu proprium quendam gustum urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gutta: <entryFree id="n20038" type="main" key="gutta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gutta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (archaic <sense id="n20038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> guttaiï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 614</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a drop</hi> of a fluid (cf.: stilla, stiria). </sense><sense id="n20038.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus quem in cadentibus guttis, quod intervallis distinguitur, notare possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttae imbrium quasi cruentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutta cavat lapidem, consumitur annulus usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ego in os meum hodie vini guttam indidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttam haud habeo sanguinis (prae metu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutta per attonitas ibat oborta genas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:90" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>amber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same, Phaëthontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:32:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: Arabicae, perh. <hi rend="ital">oil of myrrh</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 118</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis in facie non haeret gutta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>no blush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20038.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20038.3" n="1" level="3"> Guttae, <hi rend="ital">natural spots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specks on animals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stones</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nigraque caeruleis variari corpora (anguis) guttis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 578</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:461" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 461</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apium) paribus lita corpora guttis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis interstinctus aureis guttis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 13, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:84" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 27, § 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20038.4" n="2" level="3"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">a small ornament under the triglyphs of a Doric column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20038.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a drop</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a little bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi> (ante-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">gutta dulcedinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1060" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1060</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certi consilī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20039" type="main" key="Gutta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gutta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36, 98</bibl>. <cb n="GYMN" /></sense></entryFree>
guttatim: <entryFree id="n20040" type="main" key="gutta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">guttātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>gutta</etym>, <sense id="n20040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by drops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drop by drop</hi> (ante- and post-class.): lacrimae guttatim cadunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 238 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">pluvia guttatim labitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor guttatim contabescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
guttatus: <entryFree id="n20041" type="main" key="gutta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">guttātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> I. B. 1</bibl>.</etym>, <sense id="n20041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spotted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speckled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>dappled</tr>, <tr>piebald</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
guttula: <entryFree id="n20042" type="main" key="guttu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">guttŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>gutta</etym>, <sense id="n20042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little drop</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ah, guttula pectus mihi ardens aspersisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorum guttulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 427</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
guttur: <entryFree id="n20043" type="main" key="guttur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">guttur</orth>, <itype>ŭris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (ante-class.; also <gen>m.</gen> in <sense id="n20043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> gutturem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:Com. Fragm. v. 118" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> Com. Fragm. v. 118</bibl> Rib.), <hi rend="ital">the gullet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throat</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">faux, gula, jugulum): da meo gutturi gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter gutturque resident ferias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttur homini tantum et suibus intumescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 68, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tumidum guttur miratur in Alpibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 162</bibl></cit>: (tamquam si in Alpibus gutturosos homines admireris, ubi tales sunt plurimi scilicet: nam lata et inflata colla habent, Vet. Schol. ad h. 1.): haud modicos tremulo fundens e gutture cantus, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 8, 14: liquidum tenui gutture cantat avis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentis olim si quis impia manu Senile guttur fregerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">fodere guttura cultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo ligare guttura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 135</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20043.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">gluttony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memorabile magni Gutturis exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 114</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">inferior, i. e. anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gutturnium: <entryFree id="n20044" type="gloss" key="gutturnium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gutturnium</orth> <itype>vas</itype>, ex quo aqua in manus datur: ab eo, quod propter oris angustias guttatim fluat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=98" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 98</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
gutturosus: <entryFree id="n20045" type="main" key="guttu^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">guttŭrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>guttur</etym>, <sense id="n20045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a tumor in the throat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goitred</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis naturā gutturosus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:12:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 12, § 2</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:112:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 112, 2</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 162</bibl>; cf. guttur.</sense></entryFree>
gutus: <entryFree id="n20046" type="main" key="gutus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gutus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">guttus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gutta</etym>, <sense id="n20046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narrow-necked vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruet</hi>, from which liquids (wine, oil, ointments, etc.) are poured by drops: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vinum dabant, ut minutatim funderent, a guttis gutum appellarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=124" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 124</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">faginus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 38, 73, § 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:263" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:158" default="NO">11, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:52" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 52</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paterā gutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gyaros: <entryFree id="n20047" type="main" key="Gy^a^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gyăros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gyăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gyăra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gu/aros, *gu/ara</foreign>, <sense id="n20047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small barren island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used by the Romans under the empire as a place of exile for criminals</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Chiura</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 1 sq.</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 29, 43, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:68 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 68 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:73" default="NO">1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:222" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 57, 82, § 222</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gyas: <entryFree id="n20048" type="main" key="Gy^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gyas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gyes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gu/hs</foreign>. <sense id="n20048.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A giant with a hundred arms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:593" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 593</bibl> (this the better read. inst. of Gyges).—</sense><sense id="n20048.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 460</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20048.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Latin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 318</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gygaeus: <entryFree id="n20049" type="main" key="Gy_^gaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gȳ^gaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n20049.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
gyges: <entryFree id="n20050" type="main" key="Gy_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gȳges</orth>, <itype>is or ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gu/ghs</foreign>. <sense id="n20050.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for the possession of a ring with which he could render himself invisible</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:17 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 17 sq.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n20050.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gȳgaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Lydian</hi>: Lydia Gygaeo tincta puella lacu, <hi rend="ital">a lake near Sardes</hi> (the Homer. <foreign lang="greek">li/mnh *gugai/h</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl> (4, 10), 18; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20050.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 762</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20050.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A beautiful youth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 5</bibl> (but as a name of the giant, Gyas is the correct read.; v. that art.).</sense></entryFree>
gylippus: <entryFree id="n20051" type="main" key="Gy^lippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gylippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gu/lippos</foreign>. <sense id="n20051.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Arcadian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who came to Italia with Evander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 272</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20051.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous Spartan general in the Peloponnesian war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:199" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gymnas: <entryFree id="n20052" type="greek" key="gymnas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gymnas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gumna/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wrestling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the exercise of wrestling</hi> (in post-Aug. poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">Herculeā turpatus gymnade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:106" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cont. Sym. 2, 517</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere protervas Gymnadas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:358" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 358</bibl></cit>. <cb n="GYPS" /></sense></entryFree>
gymnasiarchus: <entryFree id="n20053" type="greek" key="gymna^si^archus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gymnăsĭarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gumnasi/arxos</foreign>, <sense id="n20053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the master of a gymnasium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gymnasiarch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:10:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 10, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">gym-năsĭarcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gumnasia/rxhs</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 465, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gymnasium: <entryFree id="n20054" type="greek" key="gymna^si^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gymnăsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, =<foreign lang="greek">gumna/sion</foreign>, <sense id="n20054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public school among the Greeks for gymnastic exercises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gymnasium.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20054.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgineum (in Sparta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes">15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:3 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 3 al.</bibl>—Comically: gymnasium flagri, qs. <hi rend="ital">school for the scourge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whipping-post</hi>, a term of reproach applied to one who is often flogged, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totus doleo, ita me iste habuit senex gymnasium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he has belabored me so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20054.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a public school among the Greeks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a highschool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">college</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia gymnasia atque omnes philosophorum scholae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:115" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 115</bibl>: quae vix in gymnasiis et in otio Stoici probant, Cic. Par. prooem. 1.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a college-building on Cicero's Tusculan estate: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ambulandi causa in Lyceum venissemus (id enim superiori gymnasio nomen est), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20055" type="main" key="Gymna^sium2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gymnăsium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*gumna/sion</foreign>, dim. of <foreign lang="greek">*gumna/s</foreign>), <sense id="n20055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Greek maiden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gymnasium mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gymnasticus: <entryFree id="n20056" type="greek" key="gymnasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gymnastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">gumnastiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to bodily exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gymnastic</hi> (Plautinian, for which Cic. uses gymnicus): <cit><quote lang="la">pro exercitu gymnastico et palaestrico hoc habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte gymnastica, disco, hasta, pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit> (a spurious line).</sense></entryFree>
gymnicus: <entryFree id="n20057" type="greek" key="gymni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gymnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">gumniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for bodily exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gymnastic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi qui gymnici nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gymnosophistae: <entryFree id="n20058" type="main" key="gymno^so^phistae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gymnŏsŏphistae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gumnosofistai/</foreign> (naked philosophers), <sense id="n20058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Indian ascetics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gymnosophists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sect of hermits who disregarded the decencies of life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 351</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 404 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3</bibl> ext. 6.</sense></entryFree>
gynaeceum: <entryFree id="n20059" type="greek" key="gy^naece_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gynaecēum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">gynaecīum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">gun-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gunaikei=on</foreign>. <sense id="n20059.0" n="I" level="1"> Among the Greeks, <hi rend="ital">the inner part of the house where the women dwelt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the women's apartments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20059.1" n="II" level="1"> Among the Romans, <hi rend="ital">the emperor's seraglio</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where also women spun and wove the imperial garments</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matresfamilias ingenuae ac nobiles in gynaeceum rapiebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Mort. Pers. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gynaeciarius: <entryFree id="n20060" type="main" key="gy^naeci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gynaecĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>gynaeceum, II.</etym>, <sense id="n20060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the overseer of a seraglio</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 7, 3</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">gynaecĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Cod. Th. 10, 20, 2.</sense></entryFree>
gynaeconitis: <entryFree id="n20061" type="greek" key="gy^naeco_ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gynaecōnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gunaikwni=tis</foreign>, i. q. gynaeceum, I., <sense id="n20061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the women's apartments</hi> in a Grecian house, Nep. Vit. praef. § 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gyndes: <entryFree id="n20062" type="main" key="Gyndes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gyndes</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gindes</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gu/ndhs</foreign>, <sense id="n20062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Tigris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Assyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Diala</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Kerkah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:141" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 141</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 3, 21, 1 (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 10</bibl>, the better read. is Gindes).</sense></entryFree>
gypseus: <entryFree id="n20063" type="main" key="gypse^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gypsĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>gypsum</etym>. <sense id="n20063.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of gypsum</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 22, § 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20063.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Covered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plastered with gypsum</hi>, = gypsatus: <cit><quote lang="la">facies (mulierum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 38, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gypso: <entryFree id="n20064" type="main" key="gypso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gypso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coat with gypsum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plaster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opercula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gypsati pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>the feet of a prisoner marked with gypsum</tr>, <tr>to show that he was to be sold for a slave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 64</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">gypsātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">covered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coated with gypsum</hi>: quibus illa (Medea) manibus gypsatissimis persuasit, ne sibi illae vitio verterent, quod abesset a patria, <hi rend="ital">with hands thickly coated with gypsum</hi> (of actors who played women's parts), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34</bibl>. <pb n="833" /> <cb n="H" /></sense></entryFree>
gypsoplastes: <entryFree id="n20065" type="greek" key="gypsoplastes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gypsoplastes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">guyopla/sths</foreign>, <sense id="n20065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worker in gypsum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stucco</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
gypsum: <entryFree id="n20066" type="greek" key="gypsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gypsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gu/yos</foreign>, <sense id="n20066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white lime plaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gypsum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20066.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 24, 59, § 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:120" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 19, 24, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:98" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 9, 39, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20066.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">figures in gypsum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plaster images</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plena omnia gypso Chrysippi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gyrinus: <entryFree id="n20067" type="greek" key="gy^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gyrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">guri=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n20067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young frog not yet fully developed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tadpole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae pariunt minimas carnes nigras, quas gyrinos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gyro: <entryFree id="n20068" type="main" key="gy_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gȳro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>gyrus</etym>. <sense id="n20068.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn round in a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheel round</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare).—</sense><sense id="n20068.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal difficile se gyrabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n20068.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go around</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:30:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 30, 32</bibl></cit>; id. Judith, 13, 12.— </sense><sense id="n20068.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post tergum eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eccl. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Macc. 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>; Serm. 12, § 20.—</sense><sense id="n20068.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">gȳrātus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">made in a circular form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rounded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamys orbe gyrato laciniosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 10, 11, § 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gyrton: <entryFree id="n20069" type="main" key="Gyrton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gyrton</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gyrtōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Pharsalia and Larissa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the village Tatári</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Gyrtone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 831" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 831</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
