gyrus: <entryFree id="n20070" type="greek" key="gy_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">gȳrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">gu=ros</foreign>, <sense id="n20070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circle</hi>, esp. that which is described by a horse in its movements (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: circus, circulus, orbis, orbita). </sense><sense id="n20070.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec equi variare gyros in morem nostrum docentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">a circular course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ring</hi>, for horses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpere gyrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvo brevius compellere gyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:93" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 384</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 425</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">adytis cum lubricus anguis ab imis Septem ingens gyros, septena volumina traxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducensque per aëra gyros Miluus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes gyros volatu edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 20, 22, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grues gyros quosdam indecoro cursu peragunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23, 30, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (turbinem) pueri magno in gyro...intenti ludo exercent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gyrum Euripo addito (in Circo),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>around</tr>, <tr>round about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20070.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the place where horses are trained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a course</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">gyrum pulsat equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 11.—</sense><sense id="n20070.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">career</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>: mensis artiore (quam annus) praecingitur circulo; <cit><quote lang="la">angustissimum habet dies gyrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seu bruma nivalem Interiore diem gyro trahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similique gyro venient aliorum vices,</quote> <trans><tr>circuit</tr>, <tr>course</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:26:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 26, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines secundis rebus effrenatos tamquam in gyrum rationis et doctrinae duci oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem in exiguum gyrum compellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl> (4, 2), 21; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">attrahe vela Fortius et gyro curre, poëta, tuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dialecticae gyris consenescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
gytheum: <entryFree id="n20071" type="main" key="Gythe_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Gythēum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gythī^um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*gu/qeion</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*gu/qion</foreign>, <sense id="n20071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport in Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Eurotas</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Paleopoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 27</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20071.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gythĕātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*guqea/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Gythēum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gytheatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus, Mela, 2, 3, 9: sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 8, § 16</bibl></cit>. <cb n="H." /></sense></entryFree>
h: <entryFree id="n20072" type="main" key="H"><orth extent="full" lang="la">H</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">h</orth>, the eighth letter of the Latin alphabet and the weakest guttural. The sign is borrowed from the Greek, in which H was the old form of the spiritus asper, corresp. to the Latin H-sound (HEKATON, <foreign lang="greek">e(kato/n, *h*o*s, o(/s</foreign>, etc.). Even some of the ancients doubted whether the Latin H was properly a letter: <sense id="n20072.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">si H littera est, non nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">H litteram, sive illam spiritum magis quam litteram dici oportet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>. Before the fall of the republic, the sound of H before vowels became so weak that it was frequently omitted in writing; and this weakness became more marked in many words in the time of the empire; cf.: aheneus and aeneus; cohors and coörs; prehendo and prendo; vehemens<cb n="HABE" />  and vemens, etc. (v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 96 sqq.).As an <hi rend="ital">initial</hi> and <hi rend="ital">medial</hi>, H may be combined with any vowel, but the orthography, in this respect, was inconstant: thus we have herus and erus; honus, honera, and onus, onera; harundo and arundo; and even hac for ac (<bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 23</bibl>); aruspex and haruspex; ercisco, erctum, and hercisco, herctum; aheneus and aëneus; Annibal and Hannibal; Adria and Hadria, etc.; v. Gell. l. l.—As a sign for the aspiration of the consonants <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, <hi rend="ital">p</hi>, <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">t</hi> (as in Greek the aspirates <foreign lang="greek">x, f, q</foreign> were originally designated by KH, HH, TH), H first came into use in the seventh century of Rome; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 160</bibl>; and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">C</ref></xr>.— <hi rend="ital">Medial h</hi> is often dropped.—As a <hi rend="ital">final</hi>, <hi rend="ital">h</hi> occurs only in the interjections ah and vah.In the formation of words, <hi rend="ital">h</hi> was changed into <hi rend="ital">c</hi> before <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, as tractum from traho; vectum from veho; and coalesced with <hi rend="ital">s</hi> into <hi rend="ital">x</hi>, as traxi, vexi; cf. also onyx from onych-s; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">X</ref></xr>.As an <hi rend="ital">abbreviation</hi>, H. denotes hic, haec, hoc, hujus, etc.; habet, heres, honor, etc. HH. heredes. H. AQ. hic acquiescit. H. B. M. heredes bene merenti. H. C. Hispania citerior or hic condiderunt. H. E. T. heres ex testamento. H. F. C. heres faciundum curavit. H. L. hunc locum. H. L. ET. M. H. N. S. hic locus et monumentum heredem non sequitur. H. M. S. D. M. hoc monumentum sine dolo malo. H. S. E. hic situs est. H. S. F. hoc sibi fecit, etc.; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 461 sq.</bibl>!*? The abbreviation HS. for sestertium does not strictly belong here, because H is not the letter of that shape, but the numeral II. crossed; v. sestertius <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ha: <entryFree id="n20073" type="main" key="ha!"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ha!</orth> <pos>interj.</pos> <sense id="n20073.0" n="I" level="1"> Ha hae or hahae, an exclamation of joy, <hi rend="ital">thank heavens!</hi> hahae, nunc demum mi animus in tuto locost, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20073.1" n="II" level="1"> Ha ha he, or in one word, hahahe, an exclamation of laughter or derision, <hi rend="ital">ha! ha! ha! Chr.</hi> Ha, ha, he! <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Quid risisti? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hahahe, jam teneo, quid sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habena: <entryFree id="n20074" type="main" key="ha^be_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>habeo; lit., that by which a thing is held; hence, in partic.</etym>, <sense id="n20074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strap.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20074.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (turbo) actus habenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jaculum parvā Libys amentavit habenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Balearis tortor habenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scalis latuit metuens pendentis habenae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the whip-lash</tr>, <tr>whip</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molles galeae habenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:365" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantarum calces tantum infimae teguntur: cetera prope nuda et teretibus habenis vincta sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>shoestrings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20074.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a rein</hi> (usually in <number>plur.</number>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lorum, corrigia): exhortatur equos, quorum per colla jubasque Excutit habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 404</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes effundit habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 818</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the reins,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 576</bibl></cit>; 11, 600; 670; <cit><quote lang="la">765 et saep.: quam potuit effusissimis habenis, stationem hostium invadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 20, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes aequat habenas,</quote> <trans><tr>the riders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:95" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20074.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20074.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small strip of diseased flesh cut out from the body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis excidenda habena est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: habenula.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n20074.5" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a rein;</hi> also abstr., <hi rend="ital">direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">management</hi>, <hi rend="ital">government</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis regere immensi summam, quis habere profundi indu manu validas potis est moderanter habenas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1096" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1096</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminibus vestris totas immittite habenas,</quote> <trans><tr>give the reins to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 280</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:391" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 391</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ventis) regem dedit, qui foedere certo Et premere et laxas sciret dare jussus habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furit immissis Vulcanus habenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classique immittit habenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 787</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 364</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates rege vatis habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: legum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodissimum est quam laxissimas habenas habere amicitiae, quas vel adducas cum velis vel remittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui moderandi et regendi sui potestatem quasi quasdam habenas tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 226</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepisse Numam populi Latialis habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 481</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: rerumque reliquit habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linquam datas habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:560" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 560</bibl></cit>: irarumque omnes effundit habenas, <cb n="HABE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 499</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latiae diffisus habenae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Roman dominion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:34" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
habentia: <entryFree id="n20075" type="main" key="ha^benti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>habeo, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n20075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">possessions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substance</hi> (ante-class.): animos eorum habentia inflarat, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 119, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. prol. 21</bibl>. (dub.; dum habent, Spengel).</sense></entryFree>
habenula: <entryFree id="n20076" type="main" key="ha^be_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbēnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>habena, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n20076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small strip of diseased flesh which is cut out from the body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ab ora vel vulsella vel hamo apprehensam tamquam habenulam excidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes">20</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
habeo: <entryFree id="n20077" type="main" key="ha^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype> (archaic <sense id="n20077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> habessit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> haberier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 111</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kw/ph</foreign>, handle; Lat. capio; Germ. haben, Haft; Engl. have</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi>, in the widest sense of the word, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contain</hi> (cf.: teneo, possideo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n20077.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n20077.2" n="A" level="2"> Of personal subjects. </sense><sense id="n20077.3" n="1" level="3"> With persons or things as objects: SI INTESTATO MORITVR, CVI SVVS HERES NEC SIT, AGNATVS PROXIMVS FAMILIAM HABETO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 26, 1</bibl>: ex tui animi sententia tu uxorem habes? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 260</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam habere in matrimonio, Cic. Scaur. § 8: ipsum ex Helvetiis uxorem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si et prudentes homines et non veteres reges habere voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum patrem clarissimum, amplissimos patruos, ornatissimum fratrem haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille haberet filium delicatiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non ingenuous habeat clarosque parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebat saepe ducentos, saepe decem servos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum habere, Cic. Tull. § 14: cur pecuniam non habeat mulier?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas divitias habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 99</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia magna Divitiasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denique sit finis quaerendi, cumque habeas plus, Pauperiem metuas minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitus pasci si posset corvus, haberet Plus dapis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysii equus quid attulit admirationis, quod habuit apes in juba?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31, 67</bibl></cit>: faenum habet in cornu; <cit><quote lang="la">longe fuge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges in monumentis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis habet muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis habet portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:45 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 45 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam vellem Panaetium nostrum nobiscum haberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronem secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea legione, quam secum habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secum senatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:31:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 31, § 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: magnum numerum equitatus circum se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec si habeat aurum, quod illi renumeret, faciat lubens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid non habuisti quod dares? Habuisse se dicet, Cic. Scaur. § 19: quod non desit, habentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in foro turbaque, quicum colloqui libeat, non habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.4" n="2" level="3"> With abstr. objects: quid illos, bono genere gnatos, opinanimi animi habuisse atque habituros dum vivent? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod uno et eodem temporis puncto nati dissimiles et naturas et vitas et casus habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 45, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumenta animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero habere virtutem satis est, quasi artem aliquam, nisi utare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in populos perpetuam potestatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in populum vitae necisque potestatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; 32; <cit><quote lang="la">36: eo plus auctoritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summam prudentiam summamque vim dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Lucilius Balbus tantos progressus habebat in Stoicis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quem usum belli haberent aut quibus institutis uterentur, reperiri poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullam invidiam ex eo, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 283</bibl></cit>: nimiam spem, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem in fide alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:39:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 39, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum spei ad vivendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 14</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: summam spem de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium in equestrem ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 55, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 6: consolationem<pb n="834" /> <cb n="HABE" />  semper in ore atque in animo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=56" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 56</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">rogavi, ut diceret, quid haberet in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque modum neque modestiam victores habere,</quote> <trans><tr>observe no bounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. modus: haec habebam fere, quae te scire vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec habui de amicitia quae dicerem,</quote> <trans><tr>this is what I had to say</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: fidem, gratiam, honorem, rationem; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">these nouns</ref></xr>.—In a play on the word lumen: Arge, jaces; quodque in tot lumina lumen habebas Exstinctum est, <hi rend="ital">the light for so many lights</hi> (<hi rend="ital">eyes</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 720</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (analog. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/xw</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to have</hi> something to do, <hi rend="ital">be able</hi> to do something: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo etiam dicere quem contra morem majorum dejecerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publica nihil habeo ad te scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 6</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or with the <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">to have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be obliged</hi> to do something, <hi rend="ital">I must</hi> do something: <cit><quote lang="la">rogas, ut id mihi habeam curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius hominis, quod carne indui haberet in terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habemus humiliare eum in signo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 18, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod plurimae haereses haberent existere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam Filius Dei mori habuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inimicos jubemur diligere, quem habemus odisse?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de spatiis ordinum eatenus praecipiendum habemus, ut intelligant agricolae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim cum enitendum haberemus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nunc primum statuendum haberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum respondendum haberent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.6" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. or abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">prima classis LXXXVIII. centurias habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ille nihil habet religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humani animi eam partem, quae sensum habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus incorruptus agit atque habet cuncta, neque ipse habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinus animus mortale nihil habuit, Cic. Scaur. § 50: habet statum res publica de tribus secundarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Rep. 1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum est genus illarum rerum publicarum, quod non habeat iter ad finitimum quoddam malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa aequabilitas est iniqua, cum habeat nullos gradus dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla alia in civitate...ullum domicilium libertas habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri casus plus honoris habuerunt quam laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viri excellentis ancipites variique casus habent admirationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fam. 5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet etiam amoenitas ipsa illecebras multas cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Rep. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habet illius carminis simile haec oratio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam habet vim disciplina verecundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo habere dicimur febrem, cum illa nos habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia somnus habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 329</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me somno gravatum Infelix habuit thalamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 521</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non me impia namque Tartara habent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habentque Tartara Panthoiden,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (metus) major absentes habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et habet mortalia casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror habet vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:549" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 549</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n20077.7" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20077.8" n="A" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">possess property</hi> (mostly <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">miserum istuc verbum et pessumum'st, habuisse et nihil habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 10</bibl>: qui habet, ultro appetitur: qui est pauper, aspernatur, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">habet idem in nummis, habet idem in urbanis praediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:86:section=199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 86, § 199</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in nummis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Salentinis aut in Brutiis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to have possessions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 18, § 45</bibl>: nos quod simus, quod habeamus, etc., Curius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et belli rabies et amor successit habendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 327</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amore senescit habendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl> prol. 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:207" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 207</bibl>: quid habentibus auri nunquam exstincta sitis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:264" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 264</bibl>; so, habentes = <foreign lang="greek">oi( e)/xontes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the wealthy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 8, 7</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20077.9" n="2" level="3"> With an <hi rend="ital">object</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">relative-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have the means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ability</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be in a condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be able</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to know how</hi> to do or say any thing. </sense><sense id="n20077.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Alexandrina re tantum habeo polliceri, me tibi cumulate satisfacturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publica nihil habeo ad te scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec fere dicere habui de natura deorum,</quote> <trans><tr>this is the substance of what I had to say</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="HABE" /> 39, 93; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habes igitur dicere de Gaditano foedere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo etiam dicere, quem de ponte in Tiberim dejecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud affirmare pro certo habeo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic placet, an melius quis habet suadere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">relat.-clause</hi> (usually with a <hi rend="ital">negative</hi>: non habeo, quid faciam; <cit><quote lang="la">or: nihil habeo, quod faciam, dicam, etc.): de quibus habeo ipse, quid sentiam: non habeo autem, quid tibi assentiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pueris quid agam, non habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque eo quid arguas non habes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid huic responderet, non habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quid faceret habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, quo se reciperent, non haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil habeo, quod ad te scribam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil habeo, quod agam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil habeo, quod cum amicitia Scipionis possim comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To have in use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make use of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi> (very rare, for the usual uti, opp. abuti): <cit><quote lang="la">anulus in digito subter tenuatur habendo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by use</tr>, <tr>by wearing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 312</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aera nitent usu: vestis bona quaerit haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe quas (divitias) honeste habere licebat, abuti per turpitudinem properabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae opes innocenter paratae et modeste habitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20077.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec inmensa barbarorum scuta, enormis hastas, inter truncos arborum perinde haberi quam pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo rem publicam habuerint (majores), disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20077.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep</hi> a person or thing in any condition; <hi rend="ital">to have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">regard</hi> in any light: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in obsidione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in liberis custodiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in custodiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 52:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 52, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: in custodiam habitus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>put into prison and kept there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facilius omne Hadriaticum mare in potestatem haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. in potestate): <cit><quote lang="la">cum talem virum in potestatem habuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 112 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res eos in magno diuturnoque bello inter se habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 79:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 79, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios in ea fortuna haberent, ut socii esse quam cives mallent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegros in tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam caelestem sub dio in sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in otio militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones habebantur per otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externa sine cura habebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 79 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus sine imperio et modestia habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ille postea magno in honore habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:77:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 77, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: quos praecipuo semper honore Caesar habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo Junium (mensem) et Quintilem in metu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.— So with an <pos>adj.</pos> or a <hi rend="ital">perf. part.</hi>, to denote a lasting condition: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me mea forma habet sollicitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 95</bibl></cit> Lorenz; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserrimum ego hunc habebo amasium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 27 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetum Germanicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitum habebat cogitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20077.15" n="2" level="3"> With a <hi rend="ital">double object</hi>, esp. freq. with the <hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">possess</hi> a person or thing in any quality or capacity, as any thing; <hi rend="ital">to have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">possess</hi> an action as completed, finished (a pregn. circumlocution for the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum haberet collegam in praetura Sophoclem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an heredem habuerit eum, a quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec illum perdidit assentatio, nam absque te esset, ego illum haberem rectum ad ingenium bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ergo unus tu Apollonidenses miseriores habes quam pater tuus habuit umquam?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvium habuerunt patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas civitates stipendiarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (cognomen) habes hereditarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae habuit venalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 144</bibl></cit>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui auro habeat soccis suppactum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me segregatum habuisse, uxorem ut duxit, a me Pamphilum,</quote> <trans><tr>have kept him away</tr>, <tr>aloof</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusum in curia senatum habuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romulus) habuit plebem in clientelas principum descriptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: satis mihi <cb n="HABE" /> videbar habere cognitum Scaevolam ex iis rebus, quas, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:40:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 40, 147</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si nondum eum satis habes cognitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 15, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: fidem spectatam jam et diu cognitam, id. Div. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:4:11" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decumas ad aquam deportatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Verr. 2:3:14:section=36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domitas habere libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:de Or. 1:43:194" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes philosophiae notos et tractatos locos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Or. 33:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 33, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Rep. 2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabilia, quae collecta habent Stoici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Div. 2:70:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 70, 145</bibl></cit>: quantum in acie tironi sit committendum, nimium saepe expertum habemus, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare velim ita statutum habeas, me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: habeo absolutum suave <foreign lang="greek">e)/pos</foreign> ad Caesarem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adversariis scriptum habere (nomen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Caesare satis dictum habebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:19:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 19, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum habere susceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (domum) tu iam dimensam et exaedificatam animo habebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes labores, pericula consueta habeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compertum ego habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Cat. 58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 58, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 1</bibl>: neque ea res falsum (<hi rend="ital">part. perf. pass.</hi>) me habuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 1 al.</bibl> From this use is derived the <hi rend="ital">compound perf.</hi> of the Romance languages: ho veduto, j'ai vu, qs. habeo visum, <hi rend="ital">I have seen</hi>).—</sense><sense id="n20077.16" n="3" level="3"> Also, with a double object, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipit ut dent operam, uti eos quam maxime manifestos habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pascua publica infesta habuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 29, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 36, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necdum omnia edita facinora habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 42, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anxium me et inquietum habet petitio Sexti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed Pompeium gratia impunitum habuit,</quote> <trans><tr>kept</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.17" n="4" level="3"> Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquo (aliquā re), aliquem (aliquid) habere (rare): ea si fecissem, in vestra amicitia exercitum, divitias, munimenta regni me habiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vobis liberos, parentes, consanguineos habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majora in eo obsequia habiturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.18" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hold</hi> a person in any manner, <hi rend="ital">to treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is, uti tu me hic habueris, proinde illum illic curaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatu agmen adversariorum male habere et carpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 63, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum luxuriose nimisque liberaliter habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 5</bibl></cit> Kritz; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eos ille non pro vanis hostibus, ut meriti erant, sed accurate et liberaliter habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 103, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:113:2" default="NO" valid="yes">113, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabiis plurimi (saucii) dati, nec alibi majore cura habiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 34, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">video quam molliter tuos habeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militant vobiscum, qui superbe habiti rebellassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines tam sancte habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:33" default="NO">4, 10, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male habere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque conjugem et filium ejus hostiliter haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.19" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, and sometimes <hi rend="ital">mid.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep himself</hi> or <hi rend="ital">itself</hi> in a certain manner, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be constituted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">situated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to find one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be</hi>, in any manner. </sense><sense id="n20077.20" n="(a)" level="5"> Habere se: <cit><quote lang="la">Tironem Patris aegrum reliqui...et quamquam videbatur se non graviter habere, tamen sum sollicitus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare te habes, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:61:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 61, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi se hoc melius habent quam nos, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bene habemus nos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me bene habeo,</quote> <trans><tr>am well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: praeclare se res habeat (<hi rend="ital">is well</hi>), si, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male se res habet, cum, quod virtute effici debet, id tentatur pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 313</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum ita se res haberet, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 124</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita se res habet, ut ego, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic profecto res se habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire aveo, quomodo res se habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 35, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut se tota res habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meae res sese habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.21" n="(b)" level="5"> Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus clara aeternaque habetur,</quote> <trans><tr>exhibits itself</tr>, <tr>is</tr>, <tr>continues</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti pleraque mortalium habentur,</quote> <trans><tr>as for the most part happens in human affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.22" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (as also the Gr <foreign lang="greek">e)/xw</foreign>): Tullia nostra recte valet: Terentia minus belle habuit, Dolab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volui animum tandem confirmare hodie meum, Ut bene haberem filiae nuptiis,</quote> <trans><tr>I might enjoy myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: qui bene habet suisque amicis est volup, id. <pb n="835" /> <cb n="HABE" /> Mil. 3, 1, 130: <cit><quote lang="la">bene habent tibi principia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene habet: jacta sunt fundamenta defensionis,</quote> <trans><tr>it is well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum narras, vix credibile! atqui sic habet,</quote> <trans><tr>so it is</tr>, <tr>it is even so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 53</bibl></cit>: illasce sues sanas esse habereque recte licere spondesne? Formula emendi, ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:3:5" default="NO">2, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.23" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi> a person or thing in any manner or as any thing; <hi rend="ital">to think</hi> or <hi rend="ital">believe</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> so or so: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fidelem sibi habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos aeternos et beatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id habent hodie vile et semper habuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam illam voluptatem habemus, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum nos ut perveterem habemus... nec vero habeo quemquam antiquiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 15, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ut et rex et pater habereter omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentem Asiae et dici et haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos dicit esse habitos deos, a quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset habendus rex, quicumque genere regio natus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: non habeo nauci Marsum augurem, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus auctoritas in iis regionibus magni habebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil pensi habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: an perinde habenda sit haec atque illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese illum non pro amico, sed pro hoste habiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pro hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi in provincia relictas rationes pro relatis haberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet omnia Italica pro Romanis habeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:73" default="NO">12, 10, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc jam pro facto habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium pro certo habemus per Illyricum proficisci in Galliam,</quote> <trans><tr>to consider as certain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id obliviscendum, pro non dicto habendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 22, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc velim in maximis rebus et maxime necessariis habeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in deorum numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in hostium numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem suorum In numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: hostium numero haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numero impiorum ac sceleratorum haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Aegyptii nefas habent nominare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare nefas habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen est habendum religioni, nocentem aliquando defendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to scruple</tr>, <tr>make a conscience of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eam rem habuit religioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando tu me bene merentem tibi habes despicatui,</quote> <trans><tr>you despise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sic ludibrio tuis factis habitus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence: sic habeto, or sic habeas aliquid, or with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judge thus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be convinced</hi> or <hi rend="ital">persuaded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">know</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc nihil ad te: illud velim sic habeas, uod intelliges, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc sic habeto: si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic habeto: omnibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enitere et sic habeto, non esse te mortalem, sed corpus hoc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 24</bibl></cit>; so with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 4, 4</bibl>.—Without <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id primum ergo habeto, non sine magna causa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum habeto, civem egregium esse Pompeium, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.24" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque cuiquam mortalium injuriae suae parvae videntur: multi eas gravius aequo habuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestas facile habetur sine damno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in praesens Tiberius civiliter habuit, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tantum maleficium impune habendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 70</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 48: nec ita aegre habuit filium id pro parente ausum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb.—</sense><sense id="n20077.25" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>, a place: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Romam condidere atque habuere initio Trojani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mortales initio Africam habuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Siciliam et Sardiniam per legatos habuit,</quote> <trans><tr>rule</tr>, <tr>administer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:22" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Romanam a principio reges habuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispaniae tribus legionibus habebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; 12, 54.—</sense><sense id="n20077.26" n="2" level="3"> More freq. <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dwell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live</hi> anywhere (perh. only ante-class.; in good prose habito is used instead): quae Corinthum arcem altam habetis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 294 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ille geminus qui Syracusis habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 69</bibl></cit>: quis istic habet?<cb n="HABE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nunc adulescens habet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aedem Junonis Lucinae, ubi aeditumus habere solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 50</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">situm formamque et universorum castrorum et partium, qua Poeni, qua Numidae haberent...specularentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 4, 2</bibl></cit> (but v. Weissenb. ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n20077.27" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> (time, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem procul a republica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 12</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n20077.28" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To have in one's mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to know</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be acquainted with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem istius regis (Anci) matrem habemus, ignoramus patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: habes consilia nostra; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc cognosce de Bruto,</quote> <trans><tr>there you have</tr>, <tr>such are</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habetis igitur primum ortum tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habetis sermonem bene longum hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:88:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 88, 361</bibl></cit>;
