cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: habes nostras sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes, quae fortissime de beata vita dici putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 291</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20077.29" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To have as a habit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiarity</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">characteristic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebat hoc omnino Caesar: quem plane perditum aere alieno egentemque cognorat, hunc in familiaritatem libentissime recipiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 32, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.30" n="K" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pronounce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium quaerebam, iter hac habui,</quote> <trans><tr>made</tr>, <tr>directed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex urbe profectus iter ad legiones habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51, 1</bibl></cit>; 3, 11, 2; 3, 106, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Cato contionatus est, comitia haberi non siturum, si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to be held</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:55:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 55, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectum (militum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. delectus: ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to deliver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis verbis ultro citroque habitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelam de aliquo apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiam de fundo cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:69:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 69, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde adventus in Syriam primus equitatus habuit interitum,</quote> <trans><tr>caused</tr>, <tr>occasioned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrocinia nullam habent infamiam, quae extra fines cujusque civitatis fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.31" n="L" level="1"> Habere in animo (or simply animo), with an <hi rend="ital">objectclause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be disposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined</hi> to do any thing (=propositum habere, constituisse, decrevisse): <cit><quote lang="la">istum exheredare in animo habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (flumen) neque ipse transire in animo habebat neque hostes transituros existimabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque bello eum invadere animo habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 25, 1</bibl></cit> dub (al. in animo), v. Drak. ad h. l.—</sense><sense id="n20077.32" n="M" level="1"> Habere sibi or secum aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to keep to one's self</hi> (lit. and trop.): <cit><quote lang="la">clamare coeperunt, sibi ut haberet hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:19:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 19, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vindicationem his verbis legamus: DO LEGO, CAPITO, SUMITO, SIBI HABETO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 24, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. § 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:209" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 209</bibl>.—So the formula used in divorces: <cit><quote lang="la">res tuas tibi habeas or habe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1:section=7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam suam suas res sibi habere jussit ex duodecim tabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 69</bibl></cit>. —Comic. transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">apage sis amor: tuas tibi res habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreto hoc audi, tecum habeto, ne Apellae quidem liberto tuo dixeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum haec tu tecum habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.33" n="N" level="1"> Of a sweetheart, <hi rend="ital">to have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to possess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam nos Amaryllis habet, Galatea reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:65" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl> (4, 7), 22: <cit><quote lang="la">duxi, habui scortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 58</bibl>: cum esset objectum, habere eum Laida; <cit><quote lang="la">habeo, inquit, non habeor a Laide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.34" n="O" level="1"> Gladiatorial t. t., of a wounded combatant: hoc habet or habet, <hi rend="ital">he has that</hi> (i. e. that stroke), <hi rend="ital">he is hit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desuper altus equo graviter ferit atque ita fatur: Hoc habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 296</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.35" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc habet: reperi, qui senem ducerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 99</bibl>: egomet continuo mecum; <cit><quote lang="la">Certe captus est! Habet!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 56</bibl></cit> (id est <cb n="HABI" /> vulneratus est. Habet enim qui percussus est: et proprie de gladiatoribus dicitur, Don.).—Hence: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">held</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kept in a certain condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humor</hi> (ante-class.). </sense><sense id="n20077.36" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n20077.37" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: equus nimis strigosus et male habitus, Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 11</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>—</sense><sense id="n20077.38" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut patrem tuum vidi esse habitum, diu etiam duras (lites) dabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20077.39" n="B" level="2"> In partic., physically, <hi rend="ital">well kept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well conditioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleshy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corpulent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpulentior videre atque habitior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua (virgo) est habitior paulo, pugilem esse aiunt, deducunt cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: (censores) equum nimis strigosum et male habitum, sed equitem ejus uberrimum et habitissimum viderunt, etc., Massur. Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
habilis: <entryFree id="n20078" type="main" key="ha^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>habeo, II. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n20078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be easily handled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">managed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manageable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nimble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n20078.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(calcei) habiles et apti ad pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(natura homini) figuram corporis habilem et aptam ingenio humano dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">res aptae, habiles et ad naturam accommodatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:20:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitate habiles gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 46, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetra ad tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:607" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frameae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus habilissimum quadratum est, neque gracile neque obesum,</quote> <trans><tr>the most convenient for managing</tr>, <tr>treating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">materia levis est et ad hoc habilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque habilis membris venit vigor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>making supple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bos) nec feturae habilis nec fortis aratris,</quote> <trans><tr>fit</tr>, <tr>proper for</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra frumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptum ut feraciorem habilioremque annonae urbicae redderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguibus hae (vites) terris habiles, levioribus illae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudem ad pedestria bella Numidarum gentem esse, equis tantum habilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ducenta fere milia peditum, armis habilia,</quote> <trans><tr>able to bear arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum portandis habiles gravioribus armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:588" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 588</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20078.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: sunt quidam ita in iisdem rebus habiles, ita naturae muneribus ornati, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">apt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi> (= capax), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutior atque habilior ad inveniendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ingenium idem ad res diversissimas habilius fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus non habilis gubernaculo,</quote> <trans><tr>not easy to govern</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:113:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 113, 2</bibl></cit>: negotia expedita et habilia sequuntur actorem, Sen. de Ira, 3, 7: et vicina seni non habilis Lyco, <hi rend="ital">not suited</hi> (on account of her age), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habiles Colchi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>uncivilized</tr>, <tr>rude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:231" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 231</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20078.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaudentique habiles Caryae resonare Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:225" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 225</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 553</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">handily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aptly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expertly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easily</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">scutum parvum habiliter ferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut elephantis, sicut nos equis, facile atque habiliter utantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
habilitas: <entryFree id="n20079" type="hapax" key="ha^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>habilis</etym>, <sense id="n20079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aptitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ability</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omitto opportunitates habilitatesque reliqui corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habiliter: <entryFree id="n20080" type="main" key="ha^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. habilis <sense id="n20080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
habitabilis: <entryFree id="n20081" type="main" key="ha^bi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>habito</etym>, <sense id="n20081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">habitable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20081.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinguli (terrae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">media plaga (terrae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:611" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habitabile frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20081.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">inhabited</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarpeiae rupes Superisque habitabile saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:541" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 541</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habitaculum: <entryFree id="n20082" type="main" key="ha^bi^ta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dwellingplace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habitation</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n20082.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20082.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the body, as the <hi rend="ital">dwellingplace</hi> of the soul, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
habitatio: <entryFree id="n20083" type="main" key="ha^bi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabiting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad habitationem praebere mansionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: aquarum, Firm. Math. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20083.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habitation.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n20083.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domus, domicilium, sedes, mansio, tectum): scelestae haec aedes, impiast habitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nobis haec habitatio Bona, fausta ... eveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: peto a te, ut ei de habitatione accommodes,<pb n="836" /> <cb n="HABI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus habitationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui gratuitam habitationem praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:153" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 153</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedes habitationum annuae,</quote> <trans><tr>house-rent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20083.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rent for a dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">house-rent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuam habitationem Romae usque ad bina milia nummum remisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habitatiuncula: <entryFree id="n20084" type="main" key="ha^bi^ta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>habitatio</etym>, <sense id="n20084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dwelling</hi> (late Lat.): in specubus habitatiunculas habere, Hier. in Obad. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
habitator: <entryFree id="n20085" type="main" key="ha^bi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>habito</etym>, <sense id="n20085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dweller</hi> in a house, <hi rend="ital">tenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam (domum) in Carinis mundi habitatores Lamiae conduxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inesse aliquem habitatorem in hac caelesti ac divina domo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 35, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultu habitatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62, 3 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testa in illa vidit habitatorem magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:311" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 311</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20085.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant</hi> of a country, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">incolae atque habitatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas habitatoribus vacua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitatores pagorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22, 8, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habitatrix: <entryFree id="n20086" type="main" key="ha^bi^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>habitator</etym>, <sense id="n20086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that inhabits</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
habitio: <entryFree id="n20087" type="hapax" key="ha^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>habeo</etym>, <sense id="n20087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a having</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitio gratiae, non habitio, cum pecunia confertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habito: <entryFree id="n20088" type="main" key="ha^bi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n20088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> of the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> habitantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 90</bibl>), <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>habeo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n20088.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to have frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wont to have</hi> (anteclass. and very rare): epicrocum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 318, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20088.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to have possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inhabit</hi> a place; and more freq. <hi rend="ital">neut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dwell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live</hi> anywhere (the class. signif. of the word; cf.: colo, incolo, commoror). </sense><sense id="n20088.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20088.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum urbes habitant magnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nemus, hunc collem (deus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humiles casas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 195</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:177" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51, 3</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colitur ea pars (urbis) et habitatur frequentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx procul iis, quae habitabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">applicata colli habitatur colonia Corinthus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7, 7, § 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythiae confinis est regio habitaturque pluribus vicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis habitabitur orbis Ultimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:127" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus Bistoniis habitata viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 430</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec patria est habitata tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:654" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 654</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">raris habitata mapalia tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 340</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(agellus) habitatus quinque focis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi olim uberes magnisque urbibus habitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit tellus habitanda (sibi), requirit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cesserunt nitidis habitandae piscibus undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitandaque fana Apris reliquit et rapacibus lupis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proavis habitatas linquere silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:152" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 152</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20088.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illisce habitat aedibus Amphitruo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 97</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus hic in aediculis habitat decem, ut opinor, milibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gurgustio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in via,</quote> <trans><tr>on the high-road</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Sicilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arboribus (aves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lilybaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis opacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallibus imis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casa straminea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 20; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub terra habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:309" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 309</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">64: cum illa apud te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 41</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">triginta milibus dixistis eum habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc si quis tanti (i. e. sex milibus) habitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene,</quote> <trans><tr>to have a good habitation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dum sic ergo habitat Cetronius,</quote> <trans><tr>so splendidly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avecta est peregre hinc habitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">is habitatum huc commigravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 77</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">rus habitatum abii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commorandi natura deversorium nobis, non habitandi locum dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitandi causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112, 8</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtantes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants</hi>: numquam tecta subeamus: super habitantes <cb n="HABI" /> aliquando procumbunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum valetudine habitantium infame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad occasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 70, 82, § 180</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides, habitari in terra raris et angustis in locis, et in ipsis quasi maculis, ubi habitatur, vastas solitudines interjectas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitari ait Xenophanes in luna,</quote> <trans><tr>that the moon is inhabited</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicorum, quibus frequenter habitabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:62:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 62, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20088.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwell</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">keep</hi> in any place; <hi rend="ital">to keep to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwell upon</hi> a thing (a favorite expression with Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">cum iis, qui in foro habitarunt, de dignitate contendas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habitare in Rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:89:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 89, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in subselliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 264</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: in oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>to be always in public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi qui hoc solum colendum ducebant, habitarunt in hac una ratione tractanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bonis haerebit et habitabit suis,</quote> <trans><tr>to dwell upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 292</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui potest igitur habitare in beata vita summi mali metus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his habitare pernoctareque curis (i. e. studiis)!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum in vultu habitant oculi mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus habitat in oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 145</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mens ibi (in corde) habitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 69, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tibi (Amori) jucundumst, siccis habitare medullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit> (3, 3), 17: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinatus est hujus animus in nequitia, non habitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum habita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>retire within thyself</tr>, <tr>examine thyself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habitudo: <entryFree id="n20089" type="main" key="ha^bi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>habitus, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from habeo</etym>, <sense id="n20089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi> of the body (mostly ante- and postclass., for the class. habitus): qui color, nitor, vestitus, quae habitudo est corporis! *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus atque habitudo,</quote> <trans><tr>dress and figure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 118.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam varias habitudines corporis participat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 282, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habituo: <entryFree id="n20090" type="main" key="ha^bi^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring into a condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habit</hi> of body; in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be constituted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conditioned</hi> in any manner, <hi rend="ital">to be in any condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habit</hi> of body (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si nutrix malo suco atque corpore habituari videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:79" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 4:8:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
habiturio: <entryFree id="n20091" type="hapax" key="ha^bi^tu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtūrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n20091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. a.</hi> [habeo], <hi rend="ital">to desire to have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to long for</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">si arationes Habituris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habitus: <entryFree id="n20092" type="main" key="ha^bi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from habeo, q. v. <sense id="n20092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20093" type="main" key="ha^bi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăbĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. <itype>habitus</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from habeo</etym>, <sense id="n20093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">state</hi> of a thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n20093.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20093.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deportment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi> of the body (in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille vir (Q. Metellus) integerrima aetate, optimo habitu, maximis viribus eriperetur bonis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui habitus et quae figura non procul abesse putatur a vitae periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:313" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91, 313</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non tam habitus corporis opimos quam gracilitates consectentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 91, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris et vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitu corporis brevis fuit (Horatius), Suet. Vit. Hor.: corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">positio caeli corporibus habitum dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adde vultum habitumque hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderati aequabilesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa virginali habitu atque vestitu,</quote> <trans><tr>deportment</tr>, <tr>appearance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Himera in muliebrem figuram habitumque formata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">87: habitum vestitumque pristinum reducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestitu calciatuque et cetero habitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem habitus cunctis, tonsi rectique capilli, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:149" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus agas ... en habitum, quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 72</bibl></cit>: diversus est ascendentium habitus et descendentium: qui per pronum eunt, resupinant corpora; <cit><quote lang="la">qui in arduum, incumbunt,</quote> <trans><tr>carriage</tr>, <tr>posture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus motum et habitum et incessum imitaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl></cit>: morbus est habitus cujusque corporis contra naturam, Cael. Sab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puberem esse dicunt qui habitu corporis pubes apparet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:196" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 196</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20093.3" n="2" level="3"> Of things, esp. of places (so perh. not till after the Aug. per.), <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, etc.: (praedisccre) patrios cultusque habitusque<cb n="HACT" />  locorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 52</bibl>, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">longe alius Italiae quam Indiae visus illi habitus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">domicilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 46, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs in habitum pulveris redacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 3.—</sense><sense id="n20093.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attire</hi> (not before the Aug. per.; esp. freq in Suet.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis, vestitus): Punicus cultus habitusque suspectos legatos fecit Hannibalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theopompus permutato cum uxore habitu e custodia, ut mulier, evasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeco, Romano uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">triumphantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scenico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segmenta et longos habitus et flammea sumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:124" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:177" default="NO">3, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 85</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n20093.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20093.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui manet ut moneatur semper ... servos is habitu hau probost,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia est habitus animi communi utilitate conservata suam cuique tribuens dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae ipsius habitu prope divino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentem non ex ipsius habitu, sed ex aliqua re externa judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut habitu aut natura ... habitu, ut facile et cito irascatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:16:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 16, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rationis habitum perducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:14:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gloriari libeat alienis bonis Suoque potius habitu vitam degere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si habitum etiam orationis et quasi colorem aliquem requiritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus quidam et quasi gestus (sermonis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:18" default="NO">5, 12, 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 62</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n20093.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20093.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A state of feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposition</hi> (friendly or hostile) with regard to any one (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quis fuerit eo tempore civitatis habitus, qui singulorum animi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:99:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 99, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mens exercituum, quis habitus provinciarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic quidem Romae habitus animorum fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praesenti eos potius quam praeterito aestimat habitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20093.9" n="2" level="3"> In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">an acquired perfect state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitum appellamus animi aut corporis constantem et absolutam aliqua in re perfectionem: ut virtutis aut artis perceptionem alicujus, aut quamvis scientiam, et item corporis aliquam commoditatem, non natura datam, sed studio et industria partam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus ... in aliqua perfecta et constanti animi aut corporis absolutione consistit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
habrodiaetus: <entryFree id="n20094" type="greek" key="Habro^di^aetus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Habrŏdĭaetus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(abrodi/aitos</foreign> (living delicately), <sense id="n20094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of the painter Parrhasius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
habrotonum: <entryFree id="n20095" type="main" key="habro^to^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">habrŏtŏnum</orth>, v. abrotonum.</entryFree>
hac: <entryFree id="n20096" type="main" key="ha_c"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hāc</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. hic <sense id="n20096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> III. 1.</sense></entryFree>
hactenus: <entryFree id="n20097" type="main" key="hacte^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hac-tĕnus</orth> (a strengthened archaic form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">hacĕtĕnus</orth>, acc. to Mar. Victor. p. 2457 P.—Separated <sense id="n20097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">per tmesin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 603</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 642</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>hic- tenus; lit., as far as to this side; hence</etym>, to indicate a limit, <hi rend="ital">so far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thus far</hi> (cf. hucusque). </sense><sense id="n20097.1" n="I" level="1"> In space. </sense><sense id="n20097.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare), <hi rend="ital">to this place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thus far</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus summus inaurato crater erat asper acantho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus dominum est illa secuta suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 11, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus in occidentem Germaniam novimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 35 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac Trojana tenus fuerit fortuna secuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 62</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class. (esp. freq. in Cic.), </sense><sense id="n20097.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, to indicate the limit of a discourse or of an extract, <hi rend="ital">thus far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to this point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no further than this</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus mihi videor de amicitia quid sentirem potuisse dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus admirabor corum tarditatem, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus fuit, quod caute a me scribi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externae arbores hactenus fere sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed me hactenus cedentem nemo insequatur ultra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum hactenus evagari satis fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so after a quotation: hactenus Trogus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 52, 114, § 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus Varro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 14, 17, § 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20097.4" n="b" level="4"> In this sense usually ellipt., esp. as a formula of transition: <cit><quote lang="la">sed, si placet, in hunc diem hactenus: reliqua differamus in crastinum,</quote> <trans><tr>thus far for to-day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 44, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: ergo <pb n="837" /> <cb n="HADR" /> haec quoque hactenus: <cit><quote lang="la">redeo ad urbana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: sed haec hactenus: nunc, etc., <hi rend="ital">so much for this</hi> (very freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 24, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 30</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec hactenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed de hoc loco plura in aliis: nunc hactenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 36, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hactenus, praesertim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sed hactenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; 13, 9, 1; 14, 17, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 5, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de litteris hactenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus de soloecismo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus ergo de studiis ... proximus liber, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus de poëtis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus de mundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 8, 8, § 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus, et pariter vitam cum sanguine fudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus et gemuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:423" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus: ut vivo subiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:661" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus Aeacides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 512</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20097.5" n="II" level="1"> In time, to indicate a limit, <hi rend="ital">up to this time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thus far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">till now</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hitherto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no longer than this</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus quietae utrimque stationes fuere: postquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus pro libertate, mox de finibus pugnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 250</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac celebrata tenus sancto certamina patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 603</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 823</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispecta est et Thule, quam hactenus nix et hiems abdebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20097.6" n="III" level="1"> In extent. </sense><sense id="n20097.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, opp. to more, <hi rend="ital">to this extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">only</hi> (very rare, and not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Burrum sciscitanti hactenus respondisse: ego me bene habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 51</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so ellipt.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 16</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n20097.8" n="B" level="2"> Relat., like eatenus, <hi rend="ital">to this extent</hi> that, <hi rend="ital">so much</hi> as, <hi rend="ital">so far</hi> as, <hi rend="ital">as far</hi> as; <cit><quote lang="la">corresp. with quatenus, quoad, quod, si, ut (so most freq.), ne: hactenus non vertit (in rem), quatenus domino debet: quod excedit, vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:10:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 3, 10, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus existimo nostram consolationem recte adhibitam esse, quoad certior ab homine amicissimo fieres iis de rebus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem familiae hactenus ago, quod aliquam partem praediorum percurro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: meritoria officia sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">hactenus utilia, si praeparant ingenium, non detinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec artem quidem et praecepta duntaxat hactenus requirunt, ut certis dicendi luminibus ornentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 156</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curandus autem hactenus, ne quid ad senatum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(eum) interficere constituit, hactenus consultans, veneno an ferro vel qua alia vi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hadranum: <entryFree id="n20098" type="main" key="Ha_dra_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hādrānum</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Adr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/adra=non</foreign>, <sense id="n20098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Mount Ætna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:250" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 250</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Hādrānĭtāni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hadria: <entryFree id="n20099" type="main" key="Ha_^dri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hā^drĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Adria</orth>), ae. <sense id="n20099.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">F.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of two Italian cities.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20099.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Picenum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the emperor Hadrian</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Atri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20099.2" n="2" level="3"> Derivv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hadrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hadria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hadrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20099.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hadriānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the emperor Hadrian</hi>, Ael. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 5</bibl> sqq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hădrĭānā-lis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emperor Hadrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SODALIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 457, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 454, 71</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Don. cl. 4, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 19.— </sense><sense id="n20099.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In the country of the Veneti</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the coast of the sea named after it</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Adria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 119</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20099.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">M.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Adriatic Sea</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dux inquieti turbidus Hadriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 15</bibl>; 1, 33, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 63</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 614</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO">2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:10" default="NO">10</bibl>; 13; 2, 4, 7; 2, 7, 13.—</sense><sense id="n20099.6" n="2" level="3"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20099.7" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hā^ drĭātĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Adriāt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hadria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hadriatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>the Adriatic Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:1" default="NO">2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO">2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, Hadriaticum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20099.8" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hā^drĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Adr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 4</bibl>: vina. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20099.9" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hā^-drĭăcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Adr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:125" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hadrobolon: <entryFree id="n20100" type="greek" key="hadro^bo_lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hadrŏbōlon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(dro/bwlon</foreign> (in <cb n="HAEM" /> big lumps), <sense id="n20100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of black gum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hadrosphaerum: <entryFree id="n20101" type="greek" key="hadrosphaerum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hadrosphaerum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(dro/sfairon</foreign>, <sense id="n20101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of spikenard with large leaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hadrumetum: <entryFree id="n20102" type="main" key="Hadru_me_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hadrūmētum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Adrūm-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hadrumetus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 670</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*(adrou/mhtos</foreign>, <sense id="n20102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Africa propria, <hi rend="ital">the capital of the province</hi> Byzacene, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
