C. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20102.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hadrūmētīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Adr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hadrumetum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hadrumetine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius Albinus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Hadrumetum</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Albin. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hadrūmētī-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Hadrumetum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Hadrumetines</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 97, 2.</sense></entryFree>
hae: <entryFree id="n20103" type="main" key="hae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hae</orth>, v. hic.</entryFree>
haedilia: <entryFree id="n20104" type="main" key="Haedi^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Haedĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, prob. <sense id="n20104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain near the Sabine villa of Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 9</bibl> (so the Codd.; Bentley conjectured haeduleae, from haedulea, a little kid; but see Orell. and Dillenb. ad h. 1.).</sense></entryFree>
haedillus: <entryFree id="n20105" type="hapax" key="haedillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haedillus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hoed-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>haedus</etym>, <sense id="n20105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little kid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kidling;</hi> as a term of endearment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haedinus: <entryFree id="n20106" type="main" key="haedi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haedĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hoed-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> (* acc. to others, <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īnus</orth>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a kid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kid-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coagulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelliculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">haedina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">kid's flesh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haedui: <entryFree id="n20107" type="main" key="Haedui"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Haedui</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Aedui.</entryFree>
haedulea: <entryFree id="n20108" type="main" key="haedu^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haedŭlĕa</orth>, v. Haedilia.</entryFree>
haedulus: <entryFree id="n20109" type="hapax" key="haedu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haedŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hoed-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>haedus</etym>, <sense id="n20109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little kid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
haedus: <entryFree id="n20110" type="main" key="haedus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haedus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">hoedus</orth>, and archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">aedus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ēdus</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 19</bibl>, and see the letter H; Sabine, fedus, like fircus for hircus, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L.L. 5:section=97" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.L. 5, § 97</bibl> Müll., and see the letter F), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. huda, ram; O. H. Germ. Geiz; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xi/maros</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young goat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kid</hi> (cf.: hircus, caper). </sense><sense id="n20110.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:87:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 87, 17</bibl>.—As a fig. for wantonness: <cit><quote lang="la">tenero lascivior haedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 791</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a fig. of weakness,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20110.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <number>plur.</number>: Haedi, <hi rend="ital">a small double star in the hand of the Waggoner</hi> (Auriga), Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 110; so in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:73" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluviales Haedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9,668</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nimbosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>. —In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">purus et Orion, purus et Haedus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26</bibl></cit> (3, 22), 56.</sense></entryFree>
haemachates: <entryFree id="n20111" type="greek" key="haema^cha_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemăchātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(maxa/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n20111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blood-colored agate</hi>, a precious stone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haematicon: <entryFree id="n20112" type="greek" key="haema^ti^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemătĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(matiko/n</foreign> (bloody), <sense id="n20112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of shrub</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haematinus: <entryFree id="n20113" type="greek" key="haema^ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemătĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(ima/tinos</foreign>, <sense id="n20113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blood-red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blood-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 67, § 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
haematites: <entryFree id="n20114" type="greek" key="haema^ti_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemătītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(mati/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n20114.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">blood-stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of red iron-ore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hematite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25</bibl>, §§ 129, 130; <cit><quote lang="la">36, 20, 37, § 144.—In apposition: lapis haematites purgat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20114.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A red-colored precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haematopus: <entryFree id="n20115" type="greek" key="haema^to^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemătŏpūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(mato/pous</foreign> (blood-foot), in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 47, 64, § 130</bibl>, v. l. for himantopus, q. v.</entryFree>
haemesis: <entryFree id="n20116" type="main" key="haeme_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inflammatory disease of the eye</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haemimontus: <entryFree id="n20117" type="main" key="Haemi^montus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Haemĭmontus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Aemi-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a province of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjoining Mount Hœmus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 17, 2</bibl>; Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 11, 3</bibl>; Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 9</bibl>; Notit. Dign. Imp. Occ<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Haemĭmontāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Aemi-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Hœmimontus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 4, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haemon: <entryFree id="n20118" type="main" key="Haemon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Haemon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai(/mwn</foreign>, <sense id="n20118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Creon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the lover of Antigone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:402" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 402</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:563" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 563</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 72" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haemonia: <entryFree id="n20119" type="main" key="Haemo^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Haemŏnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Aemŏnia</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetical name of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 568</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 543</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 815</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:381" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 381</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20119.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20119.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Haemŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hœmonia</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Thessaly</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Hœmonian</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Trachin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acastus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:410" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:400" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: arcus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the constellation Sagittarius</hi><cb n="HAER" />  (because orig. the Thessalian centaur Chiron), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20119.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Haemŏ-nĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai(moni/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Hœmonian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Thessalian;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, i. q. Argonautae, <hi rend="ital">the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:506" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 506</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20119.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hae-mŏnis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Aem-</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Thessalian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 436</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:590" default="NO" valid="yes">590</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haemophthisicus: <entryFree id="n20120" type="greek" key="haemophthi^si^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemophthĭsĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(mofqisiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a person with corrupted blood</hi>, Aem. Mac. de Beton.</sense></entryFree>
haemoptyicus: <entryFree id="n20121" type="greek" key="haemopty^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemoptyĭcus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">-toĭcus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(moptuiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who spits blood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2:35" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haemorrhagia: <entryFree id="n20122" type="greek" key="haemorrha^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemorrhăgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(morragi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n20122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent bleeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hemorrhage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bleeding at the nose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 67, § 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haemorrhoicus: <entryFree id="n20123" type="greek" key="haemorrho^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemorrhŏĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(morroi+ko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has the hemorrhoids</hi> or <hi rend="ital">piles</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 3, 7; 3, 15, 2.</sense></entryFree>
haemorrhoida: <entryFree id="n20124" type="greek" key="haemorrho^i^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemorrhŏĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (discharging blood; written as Greek, <foreign lang="greek">ai(morroi+/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 9</bibl>). <sense id="n20124.0" n="I" level="1"> In medic., <hi rend="ital">the piles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hemorrhoids</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 71, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haemorrhois: <entryFree id="n20125" type="main" key="haemorrho^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemorrhŏis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(morroi+/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of poisonous serpent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:210" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 20, 81, § 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 806</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haemorrhousa: <entryFree id="n20126" type="greek" key="haemorrhousa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemorrhousa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(morrou=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n20126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that has a hemorrhage</hi>, eccl. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 9, 20</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
haemostasis: <entryFree id="n20127" type="greek" key="haemosta^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haemostăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(mo/stasis</foreign>, <sense id="n20127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that stops the flow of blood</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haemus: <entryFree id="n20128" type="main" key="Haemus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Haemus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Aemus</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Haemos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ai(=mos</foreign>. <sense id="n20128.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A high range of mountains in Thrace</hi>, now called <hi rend="ital">the Great Balkan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 219</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:390" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 390</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 6</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n20128.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:198" default="NO">6, 198</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haereditas: <entryFree id="n20129" type="main" key="haere_di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haerēdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, v. hereditas.</entryFree>
haereo: <entryFree id="n20130" type="main" key="haere^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haerĕo</orth>, <itype>haesi, haesum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n20130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hang</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hang</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sit fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain close</hi> to any thing or in any manner (class. and very freq., esp. in the trop. sense; cf. pendeo); usually constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, the simple <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, less freq. with <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n20130.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut videamus, terra penitusne defixa sit, et quasi radicibus suis haereat, an media pendeat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terra ima sede semper haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam ad radices ejus haerens excipit stomachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalarum gradus male haerentes,</quote> <trans><tr>holding</tr>, <tr>adhering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haerent parietibus scalae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerere in equo,</quote> <trans><tr>sit fast</tr>, <tr>keep his seat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: nescit equo rudis Haerere ingenuus puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male laxus In pede calceus haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haeret nonnumquam telum illud occultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnus in mala haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haesitque in corpore ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 864</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: tergo volucres haesere sagittae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 415</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scindat haerentem coronam crinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">haerentem capiti cum multa laude coronam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:570" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fames) utero haeret meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haeret pede pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi demisi retem atque hamum, quicquid haesit, extraho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">os devoratum fauce cum haereret lupi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">graves currus illuvie et voraginibus haerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis in vado haerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerentes adverso litore naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gremioque in Jasonis haerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haeret in complexu liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: Avidisque amplexibus haerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 143</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cupide in Veneris compagibus haerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1113</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: validis Veneris compagibus haerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1204</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">(anulus) caecis in eo (lapide) compagibus haesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1016" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1016</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communibus inter se radicibus haerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 325</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:554" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 554</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliis sub omnibus haerent (Somnia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius intra vaginam suam haerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">15: ipse inter media tela hostium evasit. Duo turmae haesere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>failed to break through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 33, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii globo illati haerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20130.2" n="b" level="4"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n20130.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Haerere in luto, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be in trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali in luto haerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 66</bibl></cit> (for <pb n="838" /> <cb n="HAER" /> which: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc homo in medio luto est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>); cf. haesito, I.—In salebra: proclivi currit oratio: venit ad extremum: haeret in salebra, <hi rend="ital">runs aground</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is at a loss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl>.—In a like sense, </sense><sense id="n20130.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Aqua haeret, <hi rend="ital">the water</hi> (in the waterclock) <hi rend="ital">stops;</hi> v. aqua.</sense><sense id="n20130.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20130.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain attached</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbis semper aliqui scrupus in animis haereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infixus animo haeret dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerent infixi pectore vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerere in memoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi in visceribus haerent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>firmly impressed upon my heart</tr>, <tr>memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in medullis populi Romani ac visceribus haerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi haeres in medullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnium gentium sermonibus ac mentibus semper haerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi in oculis haerebunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>will be always present</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in te omnis haeret culpa,</quote> <trans><tr>adheres</tr>, <tr>cleaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut peccatum haereat, non in eo, qui monuerit, sed in eo, qui non obtemperarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 16, 30</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potest hoc homini huic haerere peccatum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod privatarum rerum dedecus non haeret infamiae (tuae)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (Caelio) crimen non haerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque (possit) haerere in tam bona causa tam acerba injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: cum ante illud facetum dictum emissum haerere debeat, quam cogitari potuisse videatur, <hi rend="ital">must have hit</hi> (the figure being that of an arrow shot from the bow), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 219</bibl>: in quos incensos ira vitamque domini desperantes cum incidisset, haesit in iis poenis, quas, etc., <hi rend="ital">fell into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incurred those penalties</hi> (the figure is that of a bird which is limed, caught), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubie repetundarum criminibus haerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: in hoc flexu quasi aetatis fama adolescentis paulum haesit ad metas, <hi rend="ital">hung back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was caught</hi> (the figure being taken from the race-course), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 75</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. meta: neu quid medios intercinat actus, Quod non proposito conducat et haereat apte,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fits</tr>, <tr>suits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 195</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20130.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20130.8" n="1" level="3"> With the idea of nearness predominating, <hi rend="ital">to keep near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close to</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attach one's self to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">perfice hoc Precibus, pretio, ut haeream in parte aliqua tandem apud Thaidem,</quote> <trans><tr>may keep about her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum audivi in amorem haerere apud nescio quam fidicinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haeres ad latus, omnia experiris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antorem comitem, qui missus ab Argis, Haeserat Evandro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:780" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 780</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinenti Africam comes haeserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curtius Nicia (grammaticus) haesit Cn. Pompeio et C. Memmio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 14</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haeremus cuncti superis, temploque tacente Nil facimus non sponte deo,</quote> <trans><tr>cling to</tr>, <tr>depend on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 573</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n20130.9" n="b" level="4"> In a bad sense: in tergis, tergis, in tergo, <hi rend="ital">to hang upon one's rear</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pursue closely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerebit in tergis fugientium victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cum exercitu tergis eorum haesurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haerens in tergo Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit> 11 Weissenb. (better than terga, the lect. vulg.).—</sense><sense id="n20130.10" n="2" level="3"> With the idea of duration in time predominating, <hi rend="ital">to remain fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continue</hi> anywhere, <hi rend="ital">to keep at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stick to</hi> any thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">metui, ne haereret hic (Athenis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obsidione castelli exigui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa muros unius urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">circa libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>: volitare in foro, haerere in jure ac praetorum tribulibus, <hi rend="ital">to go loitering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dangling about</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 173</bibl>: et siccis vultus in nubibus haerent, <hi rend="ital">hang upon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">remain long looking at</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 331</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus, dum crederet, haesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1036" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 1036</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerere in eadem commorarique sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mea ratio in dicendo haec esse solet, ut boni quod habeat, id amplectar, ibi habitem, ibi haeream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quonam modo ille in bonis haerebit et habitabit suis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem in libris haereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 40, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">valde in scribendo haereo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima sunt, nitidis maculam haesuram figentia rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>lasting</tr>, <tr>durable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20130.11" n="3" level="3"> With the idea of hindrance to free motion predominating, <cb n="HAES" /> <hi rend="ital">to stick fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be brought to a stand-still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be embarrassed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a loss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hesitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be suspended</hi> or <hi rend="ital">retarded</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n20130.12" n="(a)" level="5"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">haerebat nebulo: quo se verteret, non habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haerebat in tabulis publicis reus et accusator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitate in his iniquitatibus unum haesisse Apollonium: ceteros profecto multos ex his incommodis pecunia se liberasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in multis nominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:24:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in media stultitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:28:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 28, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">isti physici raro admodum, cum haerent aliquo loco, exclamant, abstrusa esse omnia, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo etiam Democritus haeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at in altero illo, inquit, haeres. Immo habeo tibi gratiam. Haererem enim, nisi tu me expedisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:30:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ceteris subvenies, si me haerentem videbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid machiner? quid comminiscar? haereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aut quia non firmus rectum defendis et haeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haesit circa formas litterarum (puer),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haeres et dubitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:281" default="NO">6, 281</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20130.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc homo in lutost. Nomen nescit: haeret haec res,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is perplexing</tr>, <tr>cannot be explained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amph. 2, 2, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 59</bibl>; cf.: occisa est haec res; <cit><quote lang="la">haeret hoc negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec umquam tanta fuerit loquendi facultas, ut non titubet atque haereat, quotiens ab animo verba dissentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hectoris Aeneaeque manu victoria Graiūm Haesit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was retarded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 290</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constitit hic bellum fortunaque Caesaris haesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 547</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in hac difficultate rerum consilium haereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 36, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
haeres: <entryFree id="n20131" type="main" key="haeres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haeres</orth>, <itype>ēdis</itype>, v. heres.</entryFree>
haeresco: <entryFree id="n20132" type="main" key="haeresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haeresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n20132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [haereo], <hi rend="ital">to stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere</hi> (Lucretian): <cit><quote lang="la">primordia in terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 477</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:742" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 742</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haeresiarcha: <entryFree id="n20133" type="greek" key="haere^si^archa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haerĕsĭarcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(resia/rxhs</foreign>, <sense id="n20133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leader of a sect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heresiarch</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 253" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 253</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haeresis: <entryFree id="n20134" type="greek" key="haere^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haerĕsis</orth> (scanned <orth extent="full" lang="la">hĕrĕsis</orth> in <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 725</bibl>; Ham. 64), is and <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(/resis</foreign>. <sense id="n20134.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> (philosophical or religious) <hi rend="ital">sect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a school of thought</hi> (=secta): Cato in ea est haeresi, quae nullum sequitur florem orationis, Cic. Par. prooem. § 2; <cit><quote lang="la">as Greek,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagorae haeresim sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5 praef.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n20134.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Heretical religious doctrine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heresy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 1 sq.</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ariana,</quote> <trans><tr>the Arian heresy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimae sectae et haereses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hĕrĕsis</orth>, personif., <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 710</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Comically: joca tua plena facetiarum de haeresi Vestoriana ... risisse me satis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>craft</tr>, <tr>trade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20134.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A calling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profession</hi>: navalis, Cod. Th. 13, 6, 9 sq.</sense></entryFree>
haeretice: <entryFree id="n20135" type="main" key="haere^ti^ce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haerĕtĭce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n20135.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art. I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
haereticus: <entryFree id="n20136" type="greek" key="haere^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haerĕtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai(retiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to heretical religious doctrines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heretical</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n20136.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 41</bibl></cit>: nigredo, Arat. Act. Apost. 1, 611.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">haerĕtĭce</orth>, <hi rend="ital">heretically</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 5, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20136.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">haerĕtĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a heretic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Bapt. 115</bibl>; so the title of Tertullian's work: de Praescriptione adversus haereticos.</sense></entryFree>
haesitabundus: <entryFree id="n20137" type="hapax" key="haesi^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haesĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>haesito, II.</etym>, <sense id="n20137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stammering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faltering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expalluit notabiliter et haesitabundus inquit: Interrogavi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
haesitantia: <entryFree id="n20138" type="hapax" key="haesi^tanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haesĭtantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stammering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
haesitatio: <entryFree id="n20139" type="main" key="haesi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haesĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hesitating</hi> (rare but good prose). </sense><sense id="n20139.1" n="I" level="1"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">a stammering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui timor! quae dubitatio! quanta haesitatio tractusque verborum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 50, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20139.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mental uncertainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irresolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embarrassment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitation</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si facile inveneris quid dicas, noli ignoscere haesitationi meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocris haesitatio est, hinc justitiae proposita imagine, inde pietatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:48" default="NO">11, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haesitationem attulit tempus et locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 27, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haesitator: <entryFree id="n20140" type="main" key="haesi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haesĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who hesitates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is undecided</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum et ipse in edendo (libros) haesitator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 11, 2</bibl></cit>. <cb n="HALI" /></sense></entryFree>
haesito: <entryFree id="n20141" type="main" key="haesi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haesĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n20141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [haereo], <hi rend="ital">to stick fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain fixed</hi> in a place. </sense><sense id="n20141.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ut, si eam paludem Romani perrumpere conarentur, haesitantes premerent ex loco superiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita in vadis haesitantis frumenti acervos sedisse illitos limo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 334</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:697" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 697</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20141.2" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">haesitare in eodem luto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be exposed to the same danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20141.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (opp. firmness), <hi rend="ital">to be uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitating.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n20141.4" n="A" level="2"> In speech: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā haesitantes,</quote> <trans><tr>hesitating</tr>, <tr>stammering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20141.5" n="B" level="2"> In mind, <hi rend="ital">to be uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undecided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be at a loss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hesitate</hi> (so most freq.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctor, moror, tardo): dubitant, haesitant, revocant se interdum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haesitaret, cum teneretur, quaesivi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in novis rebus haesitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carbo ignarus legum, haesitans in majorum institutis,</quote> <trans><tr>not well versed in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num in eo, qui sint hi testes, haesitatis? id. Fragm. Or. p. Corn. 2, p. 453 Orell.: haesitavit ob eam causam, quod nesciret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque non haesitans respondebo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ad pecuniae mentionem ventum erat, haesitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut deliberare, non haesitare videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mutando rei publicae statu haesitatum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hageter: <entryFree id="n20142" type="main" key="ha_ge_te_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hāgētēr</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(ghth/r</foreign>, <sense id="n20142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hagiographa: <entryFree id="n20143" type="greek" key="Ha^gi^o^gra^pha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hăgĭŏgrăpha</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*agio/grafa</foreign>, <sense id="n20143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the last of the three principal divisions of the Old Testament Scriptures</hi>, Hier. in. Reg. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:106:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 106, 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hagiographus: <entryFree id="n20144" type="greek" key="ha^gi^ogra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăgĭogrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(gio/grafos</foreign>, <sense id="n20144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacred writer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hahae: <entryFree id="n20145" type="main" key="hahae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hahae</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hahahe</orth>, v. ha.</entryFree>
halaesa: <entryFree id="n20146" type="main" key="Halaesa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Halaesa</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Halaesinus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ha-laesus</orth>, v. Halesa, etc.</entryFree>
halagora: <entryFree id="n20147" type="greek" key="ha^la^go^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălăgŏra</orth>, <itype>as</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a(/ls-a)gora/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the saltmarket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 34</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
halapanta: <entryFree id="n20148" type="gloss" key="halapanta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">halapanta</orth> <itype>significat omnia mentientem</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=101:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 101, 18</bibl> Müll. (perh. the same word as halophanta, q. v.).</entryFree>
halatio: <entryFree id="n20149" type="main" key="ha_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hālātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>halo</etym>, <sense id="n20149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breath</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 37, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halatus: <entryFree id="n20150" type="main" key="ha_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hālātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breath of perfume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fragrance</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">florum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, § 215</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
halcedo: <entryFree id="n20151" type="main" key="halce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">halcēdo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">halcēdōnĭa</orth>, v. alcedo.</entryFree>
halcyone: <entryFree id="n20152" type="main" key="Halcy^o^ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Halcyŏne</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Halcyŏnēus</orth>, v. Alc-.</entryFree>
halec: <entryFree id="n20153" type="main" key="ha_lec"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hālec</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">hālex</orth>, v. alex.</entryFree>
hales: <entryFree id="n20154" type="main" key="Hales"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hales</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Lucania near Velia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Halente</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halesa: <entryFree id="n20155" type="main" key="Ha^le_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălēsa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Halaesa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Alēsa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/alaisa</foreign>, <sense id="n20155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the northern coast of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Halesus</hi>, now ruins near the village Iusa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:218" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:7:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 7, § 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 75, § 185</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20155.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălēsīnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Halaes-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Alēs-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Halesa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dio,</quote> <trans><tr>of Halesa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:7:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 73</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hă-lēsīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Halesa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Halesines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halesus: <entryFree id="n20156" type="main" key="Ha^le_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălēsus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Halaesus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Alēsus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/alaisos</foreign>. <sense id="n20156.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Agamemnon and Clytemnestra</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Brisēis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the founder of Falisci</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 724</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 352</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">411</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 13, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20156.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lapithœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 462</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20156.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small river on the northern coast of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which the town Halesa was situated</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 268; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haliacmon: <entryFree id="n20157" type="main" key="Ha^li^acmon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălĭacmon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Aliacmon</orth>), <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stream forming the boundary between Macedonia and Thessaly</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vistritza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haliaeetos: <entryFree id="n20158" type="greek" key="ha^li^aee^tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălĭæĕtos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">haly-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(liai/etos</foreign>, <sense id="n20158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the osprey</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sea-eagle</hi>: Falco haliaetus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Nisus, the father of Scylla, was changed into one,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 535</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haliartus: <entryFree id="n20159" type="main" key="Ha^li^artus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălĭartus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(ali/artos</foreign>, <sense id="n20159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Bœotia near the modern village of Mazi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:56" default="NO" valid="yes">56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:63" default="NO" valid="yes">63</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălĭartii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halica: <entryFree id="n20160" type="main" key="ha^li^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. alica. <pb n="839" /> <cb n="HALO" /></entryFree>
halicacabus: <entryFree id="n20161" type="greek" key="ha^li^ca_ca^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălĭcācăbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba) = <foreign lang="greek">a(lika/kabos</foreign>, <sense id="n20161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant called in pure Latin</hi> vesicaria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 20, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halicarnassus: <entryFree id="n20162" type="main" key="Ha^li^carnassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălĭcarnassus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sos</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hali-carnāsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(alikarnasso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of great antiquity in Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the historians Herodotus and Dionysius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also celebrated for the mausolēum erected there</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bodrun</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Boudroum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl> and 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20162.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20162.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălĭcarnasseus</orth>, <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(alikarnasseu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Halicarnassus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scylax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cleon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20162.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălĭcarnassĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Halicarnassus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Halicarnassians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20162.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălĭcarnas-senses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 20, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halicyensis: <entryFree id="n20163" type="main" key="Ha^li^cy^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălĭcyensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n20163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city Halicyœ</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*(aliku/ai</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">in Sicily</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Salemi</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Halicyœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sopater quidam,</quote> <trans><tr>of Halicyœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>, § 68.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Halicy-enses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Halicyœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Halicyœans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:40:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 40, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halieuticus: <entryFree id="n20164" type="greek" key="ha^li^euti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălĭeutĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(lieutiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fishing</hi>: boletar, Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Halieutica</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a title of a poem on fishing. by Ovid;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halimon: <entryFree id="n20165" type="main" key="ha^li^mo^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălĭmŏn</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(/limon</foreign>, <sense id="n20165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the orach</hi> (Atriplex halimus of Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 239</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 33, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haliphloeos: <entryFree id="n20166" type="greek" key="ha^liphloeos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăliphloeos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(li/floios</foreign> (seabark), <sense id="n20166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of oak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halipleumon: <entryFree id="n20167" type="greek" key="ha^lipleumon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălipleumon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(lipleu/mwn</foreign> (sea-lungs), <sense id="n20167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halito: <entryFree id="n20168" type="main" key="ha_li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hālĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>halo</etym>, <sense id="n20168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to breathe out</hi>: flammam halitantes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 336</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 217 Vahl.).—So perh. also: Scio spiritum ejus majorem esse multo quam folles taurini halitant, Plaut. Fragm. Bacch.; cf. Ritschl in Rhein. Mus. 1846, p. 580.</sense></entryFree>
halitus: <entryFree id="n20169" type="main" key="ha_li^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hālĭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">alitus</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhalation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vapor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20169.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): Nemeaeus leo Frendens efflavit graviter extremum halitum, <hi rend="ital">his last breath</hi>, * <cit><quote lang="la">Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22: aegris faucibus exsuperat gravis halitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:88" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (i. e. nebulae aestusque) velut halitus sursum feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pulmone halitus graveolentia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stinking breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 53, § 194</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 20, 83, § 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:56" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 14, § 56</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">artificis halitus oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:238" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die ex ore (ebriorum) halitus cadi,</quote> <trans><tr>fumes of wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbi fornacium halitus noxius et pestilens,</quote> <trans><tr>exhalation</tr>, <tr>fumes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 167</bibl></cit>: carbonum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 219: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 2, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Averni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:494" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>heat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20169.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soul</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20169.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Wind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rutil. 1, 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hallelujah: <entryFree id="n20170" type="main" key="halle^lu_jah"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hallĕlūjah</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">āllĕlūia</orth>), <pos>interj.</pos> <etym>Hebr. halal, to praise; Jah = Jehovah</etym>, <sense id="n20170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praised be God! praise the Lord!</hi> Form hall-, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 86, 178</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Nol. Carm. 37, 56</bibl>. Form all-, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 13, 22</bibl>; Psa. 104, 1; Apoc. 19, 1, 3, 4 al.—Deriv. <orth extent="full" lang="la">hallĕlūjătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">psalmi,</quote> <trans><tr>devoted to praise</tr>, <tr>containing hallelujahs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Psa. 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hallex: <entryFree id="n20171" type="main" key="hallex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hallex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. allex.</entryFree>
hallucinor: <entryFree id="n20172" type="main" key="hallu_ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hallūcĭnor</orth>, <itype>āri, and its derivatives</itype>, v. aluc-.</entryFree>
hallus: <entryFree id="n20173" type="gloss" key="hallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hallus</orth>, v. allus.</entryFree>
halmyridion: <entryFree id="n20174" type="greek" key="halmyri^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">halmyrĭdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(lmuri/dion</foreign> (saltish), <sense id="n20174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cabbage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halmyrrhax: <entryFree id="n20175" type="greek" key="halmyrrhax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">halmyrrhax</orth>, <itype>ăgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(lmu/rrac</foreign>, <sense id="n20175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of saltpetre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halo: <entryFree id="n20176" type="main" key="ha_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hālo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n20176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: feo, spiro). </sense><sense id="n20176.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to emit vapor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fragrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be fragrant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitent croceis halantes floribus horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ture calent arae sertisque recentibus halant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 417</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20176.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nardi florem, nectar qui naribus halat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 848</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:221" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:391" default="NO" valid="yes">391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48</bibl>. <cb n="HAMA" /></sense></entryFree>
halonem: <entryFree id="n20177" type="gloss" key="halonem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">halonem</orth>, <itype>id est hesterno vino languentem</itype>, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ELUCUM, p. 75 Müll.</entryFree>
