halophanta: <entryFree id="n20178" type="greek" key="ha^lo^phanta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălŏphanta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n20178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">m</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(lofa/nths</foreign> (a word comically formed after the analogy of sycophanta, <foreign lang="greek">sukofa/nths</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a salt-informer</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">a rascal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoundrel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 7</bibl>, and see halapanta.</sense></entryFree>
halos: <entryFree id="n20179" type="greek" key="ha^lo_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălōs</orth>, <itype>ō</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(/lws</foreign> (a round threshing-floor), <sense id="n20179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circle round the sun</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a halo</hi>, pure Lat. corona: <cit><quote lang="la">circa solem visum coloris varii circulum, qualis esse in arcu solet. Hunc Graeci halo vocant: nos dicere coronam aptissime possumus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">hălysis</orth> (prob. corrupted from <foreign lang="greek">a(/lws</foreign>), App. de Mundo, p. 64, 16.</sense></entryFree>
halosis: <entryFree id="n20180" type="greek" key="ha^lo_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(/lwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n20180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking by storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capture</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89, 1</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
halter: <entryFree id="n20181" type="greek" key="halter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">halter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(lth/r</foreign>, in gymnastics, <sense id="n20181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaden weights</hi> held in the hands in leaping exercises, to add to the impetus of the body, the <hi rend="ital">dumb-bells</hi> of modern gymnastics, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:49:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:6" default="NO">7, 67, 6</bibl> (pure Lat. manipuli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 2, 38</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
halucinatio: <entryFree id="n20182" type="main" key="ha_lu_ci^na_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hālūcĭnātio</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">hālūcĭnor</orth>, v. aluc.</entryFree>
halum: <entryFree id="n20183" type="main" key="ha^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. alum.</entryFree>
haluntium: <entryFree id="n20184" type="main" key="Ha^luntium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hăluntium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Aluntium.</entryFree>
halus: <entryFree id="n20185" type="main" key="Halus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Halus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small place in Assyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> Artemita, only mentioned by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halyaeetos: <entryFree id="n20186" type="main" key="halyaee^tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">halyaeĕtos</orth>, v. hali.</entryFree>
halyattes: <entryFree id="n20187" type="main" key="Halyattes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Halyattes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Alyattes.</entryFree>
halys: <entryFree id="n20188" type="main" key="Ha^lys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hălys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/alus</foreign>. <sense id="n20188.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing between Paphlagonia and Cappadocia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kisil-Irmak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum Halyn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa Halyn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Croesus Halym penetrans magnam pervertet opum vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Croeso fatalis Halys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 272</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: Halym, also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20188.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A man's name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:574" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 574</bibl>.—As a <hi rend="ital">surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 877, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
halysis: <entryFree id="n20189" type="main" key="ha^ly^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hălysis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. halos.</entryFree>
hama: <entryFree id="n20190" type="greek" key="ha^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăma</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ama</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n20190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a waterbucket</hi>, esp. for extinguishing fires, <hi rend="ital">a firebucket</hi>, Plin Ep. 10, 42, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:305" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 305</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO">33, 7, 12</bibl>, §§ 18, 21 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 42</bibl>, false reading for aula, Lorenz ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
hamadryas: <entryFree id="n20191" type="main" key="Ha^ma_dry^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hămādryas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(amadrua/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wood-nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hamadryad;</hi> in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:63" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 63</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32</bibl> (3, 30), 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 690</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 624</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 155</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. Grœc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hamadryasin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 32</bibl></cit> (like <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12</bibl> Dryasin, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:34" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34</bibl> Thyniasin).</sense></entryFree>
hamae: <entryFree id="n20192" type="main" key="Hamae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hamae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Cumœ</hi>, mentioned only by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hamarthritis: <entryFree id="n20193" type="greek" key="ha^marthri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hămarthrītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a(/ma-a)rqri=tis</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the general gout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:2:28" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hamartigenia: <entryFree id="n20194" type="greek" key="Ha^marti^ge^ni_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hămartĭgĕnīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(amartige/neia</foreign>, <sense id="n20194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Origin of Sin</hi>, the title of a poem by Prudentius.</sense></entryFree>
hamatilis: <entryFree id="n20195" type="main" key="ha_ma_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hāmātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hamatus</etym>, <sense id="n20195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with hooks</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">performed by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furnished with hooks</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">piscatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiculum scorpii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hamatus: <entryFree id="n20196" type="main" key="ha_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hāmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hamus</etym>, <sense id="n20196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with a hook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hooked.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20196.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:384" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:799" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 799</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20196.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">shaped like a hook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>: hamatis uncinatisque corporibus concreta haec esse dicat, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis, i. q. harpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 80</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum curvo tenus abdidit hamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:720" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 720</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n20196.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos ego viscatis hamatisque muneribus non sua promere puto, sed aliena corripere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>catching</tr>, <tr>alluring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 30, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. with hamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:63:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 63, 5</bibl>; v. hamus, I. B. 1. b.).</sense></entryFree>
hamaxa: <entryFree id="n20197" type="greek" key="ha^maxa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hămaxa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(/maca</foreign>, <sense id="n20197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wagon</hi>, Capitol. Max. duob. 6 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 21, 9</bibl>, in the signification of septentriones, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
hamaxagoga: <entryFree id="n20198" type="greek" key="ha^maxa^go_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hămaxăgōga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(macagwgo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries off any thing in a wagon</hi>, in comic transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hamaxitis: <entryFree id="n20199" type="main" key="ha^maxi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hămaxītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, i. q. agrostis, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 77</bibl>. <cb n="HAMU" /></sense></entryFree>
hamaxo: <entryFree id="n20200" type="greek" key="ha^maxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hămaxo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a(/maca</foreign>, a wagon</etym>, <sense id="n20200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to yoke to a wagon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hamaxobii: <entryFree id="n20201" type="main" key="Ha^maxo^bi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hămaxŏbĭi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-bĭoe</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(amaco/bioi</foreign> (living, going about in wagons), <sense id="n20201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 2</bibl>).—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hamaxobio instabilior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hamilcar: <entryFree id="n20202" type="main" key="Ha^milcar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hămilcar</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Amilcar</orth>), <itype>ăris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n20202.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Gisgo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain in besieging Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7</bibl>, ext. 8.—</sense><sense id="n20202.1" n="II" level="1"> Hamilcar Barca, <hi rend="ital">the father of Hannibal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 99</bibl>; Nep. Ham.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:72 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 72 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hamillus: <entryFree id="n20203" type="main" key="Ha^millus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hămillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a teacher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:224" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 224</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hamiota: <entryFree id="n20204" type="main" key="ha_mi^o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hāmĭōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>hamus</etym>, <sense id="n20204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an angler</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conchitae atque hamiotae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: hamiotae aucupesque, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 25, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hammitis: <entryFree id="n20205" type="greek" key="hammi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hammītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(mmi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n20205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hammochrysos: <entryFree id="n20206" type="greek" key="hammo^chry_sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hammŏchrȳsos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">amm-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)mmo/xrusos</foreign> (gold sand), <sense id="n20206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone unknown to us</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">golden mica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 188</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 15, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hammodytes: <entryFree id="n20207" type="main" key="hammo^dy^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hammŏdytes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">amm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(mmodu/ths</foreign> (sand-crawler), <sense id="n20207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an African serpent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:716 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 716 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
hammon: <entryFree id="n20208" type="main" key="Hammo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hammōn</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Amm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/ammwn</foreign>, <sense id="n20208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian and Libyan deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worshipped</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in the present oasis Siwah</hi>) <hi rend="ital">in the form of a ram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and identified by the Greeks and Romans with</hi> <foreign lang="greek">*zeu/s</foreign> <hi rend="ital">and Jupiter;</hi> hence, Juppiter Hammon. Connected with his temple was an oracle often consulted by the ancients, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:chapter=29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:514 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 514 al.</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 7, 5</bibl>).—Hence, Hammonis cornu, <hi rend="ital">a gold-colored precious stone of the shape of a ram's horn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ammonite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 167</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20208.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n20208.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hammōnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Amm-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the oasis El-Siwah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 3 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n20208.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hammōnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> Hammonium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n20208.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hammōnĭăcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Amm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Hammon</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Libya</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Africa</hi>). </sense><sense id="n20208.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:Fac. 94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. Fac. 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20208.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Hammōnĭă-cum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a resinous gum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which distilled from a tree near the temple of</hi> Juppiter Hammon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 23, 49, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 14, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hamotrahones: <entryFree id="n20209" type="gloss" key="ha_motra^ho_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hāmotrăhōnes</orth> <itype>alii piscatores, alii, qui unco cadavera trahunt</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=102" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 102</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
hamula: <entryFree id="n20210" type="hapax" key="ha_mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hāmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>hama</etym>, <sense id="n20210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small water-bucket</hi>: habilem lymphis hamulam, Col. poët. 10, 387.</sense></entryFree>
hamulus: <entryFree id="n20211" type="main" key="ha_mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hāmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>hamus</etym>, <sense id="n20211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small hook</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a small angle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—As a surgical instrument, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl> and 7.</sense></entryFree>
hamus: <entryFree id="n20212" type="main" key="ha_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hāmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">a(p-, a(/ptw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hook.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20212.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20212.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">taleae pedem longae, ferreis hamis infixis, totae in terram infodiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hamis ferreis pectitur stupa,</quote> <trans><tr>heckles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricam consertam hamis,</quote> <trans><tr>little hooks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 467</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20212.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n20212.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fish-hook;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">an angle</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">hisce hami atque haec harundines sunt nobis quaestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: divine Plato escam malorum appellat voluptatem, quod ea videlicet homines capiantur, ut pisces hamo, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 13, 44</bibl> (al. om. hamo; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Klotz in h. l.): occultum visus decurrere piscis ad hamum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 586</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19, 13</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumento piscatoris legato, ... hami quoque et cetera ejusmodi usibus destinata debentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20212.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a figure of enticement, allurement, artifice (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">meus hic est: hamum vorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vafer unus et alter Insidiatorem praeroso fugerit hamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera magna quidem misit, sed misit in hamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:63:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 63, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">munera illitos cibis hamos aemulabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:43" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">viscata hamataque munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 9, 30, 2</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n20212.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A hook</hi> as a surgical instrument, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20212.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things hooked or crooked, <hi rend="ital">the talons</hi> of a hawk, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 342</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">thorns</hi>, id. de Nuce, 115; <hi rend="ital">a kind of pastry.</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 245</bibl>. <pb n="840" /> <cb n="HARE" /></sense></entryFree>
hannibal: <entryFree id="n20213" type="main" key="Hanni^bal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hannĭbal</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Annibal</orth>), <itype>ălis</itype> (ālis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Sat. 14</bibl> Vahl.), = <foreign lang="greek">*)anni/bas</foreign> [Phoen.], <sense id="n20213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Punic surname. The most celebrated of the name is Hannibal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Hamilcar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the leader of the Carthaginians in the second Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,023:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Han. 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:210 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 210 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Romani suum Hannibalem habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 16, 10</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal ad portas, of imminent and great danger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridates, odio in Romanos Hannibal,</quote> <trans><tr>a Hannibal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:18:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hanno: <entryFree id="n20214" type="main" key="Hanno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Hanno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Anno</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)/annwn</foreign>, <sense id="n20214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Punic name. The most celebrated of the name is Hanno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general of the Carthaginians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about the year</hi> 500 B.C., <hi rend="ital">navigated the western coast of Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hanula: <entryFree id="n20215" type="gloss" key="hanu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hanŭla</orth> <itype>parva delubra, quasi fanula</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=103:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 103, 8</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
hapalopsis: <entryFree id="n20216" type="main" key="ha^pa^lopsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăpălopsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 47</bibl> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
hapaluria: <entryFree id="n20217" type="main" key="ha^pa^lu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăpălūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hapalus</etym>, <sense id="n20217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for soft eggs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 20</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
hapalus: <entryFree id="n20218" type="main" key="ha^pa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăpălus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(palo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soft;</hi> only with ova, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:17" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 104" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
haphe: <entryFree id="n20219" type="greek" key="ha^phe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăphē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aphē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(fh/</foreign> (a touching, handling; hence), <sense id="n20219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the yellow sand</hi> with which wrestlers, after being anointed, were sprinkled. </sense><sense id="n20219.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flavescit haphe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 67, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20219.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the dust of a road</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 57:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 57, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hapsus: <entryFree id="n20220" type="greek" key="hapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hapsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(/yos</foreign> (a binding together; hence), <sense id="n20220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lock of wool used in bandaging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 26, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hara: <entryFree id="n20221" type="main" key="ha^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coop</hi> for animals: <cit><quote lang="la">anserum,</quote> <trans><tr>a goose-pen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 24 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a hog-stye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 104</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confer nunc, Epicure noster, ex hara producte, non ex schola, confer, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hara suis, as a term of reproach,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
harena: <entryFree id="n20222" type="main" key="ha^re_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēna</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">ărēna</orth>, Bramb. s. v. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Prol. Verg. p. 422</bibl>, and <sense id="n20222.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sabin. fas-ena; from Sanscr. root bhas-, to shine, gleam, Corss. Ausspr. 1, 102</etym>. </sense><sense id="n20222.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">sand</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sabulum, glarea, suburra): harenae tria genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 54, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus congestus harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 724</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:726" default="NO" valid="yes">726</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litoris incurvi bibulam pavit aequor harenam,</quote> <trans><tr>the thirsty sand of the curved shore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 376</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bibula harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 114</bibl></cit> (Rib. and Forbig., but Conington arena): <cit><quote lang="la">sicca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opaci omnis harena Tagi, i. e. the gold it was believed to contain,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 115</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">nivis more incidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:30:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena nigra, = limus,</quote> <trans><tr>slime</tr>, <tr>mud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 292</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (postAug.; its use is said by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 3</bibl>, to have been ridiculed by Cæsar as a verbi vitium): <cit><quote lang="la">arenae carae, of the golden sands of Pactolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 88</bibl></cit> Merk.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (delphina) postquam bibulis inlisit fluctus harenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summae cauda verruntur arenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 701</bibl></cit> Merk.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:456" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 456</bibl>; 865; 11, 231; 499; 15, 268; 279; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:23" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 23</bibl> Queck; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl> 24; <cit><quote lang="la">but harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 350</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 31</bibl> K. and H.: <cit><quote lang="la">arenarum inculta vastitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1</bibl></cit> prol. 8; <cit><quote lang="la">of the bottom of the sea: furit aestus harenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestu miscentur harenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 557</bibl></cit>.—Prov. </sense><sense id="n20222.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Quid harenae semina mandas? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 115</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20222.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Ex incomprehensibili pravitate arenae funis effici non potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10 praef.</bibl> § 4.—</sense><sense id="n20222.4" n="(g)" level="5"> Arena sine calce, said by Caligula of Seneca, because his sentences seem like independent maxims, without connection, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20222.5" n="(d)" level="5"> Of vast numbers: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut arena quae est in litore maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 22, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20222.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20222.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">sand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sandy place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum urbis vendiderit, tum arenam aliquam emat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 71</bibl></cit> B. and K.— </sense><sense id="n20222.8" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n20222.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sandy desert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum super Libycas victor penderet arenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 617</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 417</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigras inter harenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 83: <cit><quote lang="la">Memnonis effigies, disjectas inter et vix pervias arenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20222.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The shore</hi> of the sea, <hi rend="ital">the beach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mare permotum ventis ruit intus harenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 726</bibl></cit>: litoream arenam sulcare, Ov. <cb n="HARI" /> M. 15, 725: <cit><quote lang="la">doque leves saltus udaeque inmittor arenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 3:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 599</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multaque perpessae (carinae) Phrygia potiuntur arena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub noctem potitur classis arena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 13:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 729</bibl></cit>.—So <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 540</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 316</bibl>; 11, 626 al.—</sense><sense id="n20222.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The place of combat in the amphitheatre</hi> (strewn with sand), <hi rend="ital">the arena</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amphitheatri arena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">missus in arenam aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comminus ursos figebat Numidas Albana nudus harena venator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:144" default="NO">2, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:206" default="NO">8, 206</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes in arenam luxuria projecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20222.12" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20222.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A combat in the amphitheatre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in harenam se dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operas arenae promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in opera scaenae arenaeque edenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaenae arenaeque devotus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cal. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20222.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The combatants in the arena</hi>: cum et juris idem (i. e. testandi libertas) contingat harenae, <hi rend="ital">the gladiators have the right</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:217" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 217</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20222.15" n="5" level="3"> Harena urens, <hi rend="ital">volcanic fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lava</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna ingentem vim arenae urentis effudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:30:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20222.16" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the place of combat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scene</hi> or <hi rend="ital">theatre of any contest</hi> (war, a single battle, a dispute, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">civilis belli arena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7:6" default="NO">4, 7, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in harena mea, hoc est apud centumviros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
harenaceus: <entryFree id="n20223" type="main" key="ha^re_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnācĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aren-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n20223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sandy</hi>, = harenosus (only in Plin.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 7, 4, § 43 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
harenarius: <entryFree id="n20224" type="main" key="ha^re_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aren-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>harena</etym>. <sense id="n20224.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to sand</hi>: lapis, <hi rend="ital">sandstone</hi> (= lapis bibulus of Verg.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 348</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20224.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the amphitheatre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <trans><tr>destined for the arena</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20224.2" n="III" level="1"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n20224.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n20224.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A combatant in the amphitheatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gladiator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:5" default="NO">36, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 27, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4063</bibl> (but cf. Orell. ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n20224.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A teacher of the elements of arithmetic</hi> (the figures being drawn in sand), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 6</bibl> (cf. abacus).—</sense><sense id="n20224.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnā-rĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (sc. fodina; cf.: aeraria, argentaria, etc.), <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sand-pit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arenarias quasdam extra portam Esquilinam perductus occiditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 37</bibl></cit> B. and K.—</sense><sense id="n20224.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sand-pit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harenatio: <entryFree id="n20225" type="main" key="ha^re_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aren-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id</etym>. <sense id="n20225.0" n="1" level="3"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a sanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plastering with sand.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n20225.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a plastering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cementing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harenatus: <entryFree id="n20226" type="main" key="ha^re_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aren-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sanded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mixed with sand</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">calx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 207</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (sc. opus), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">sand-mortar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:176 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 176 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
harenifodina: <entryFree id="n20227" type="main" key="ha^re_ni^fo^di_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnĭfŏdīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aren-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>harena - fodio</etym>, <sense id="n20227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sand-pit</hi> (late Lat. for harenaria; <cit><quote lang="la">s. v. harenarius, III. B.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13, § 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:7" default="NO">24, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
harenivagus: <entryFree id="n20228" type="main" key="ha^re_ni^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnĭvăgus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aren-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>harena - vagus</etym>, <sense id="n20228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wandering over sands</hi>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Luc. 9, 941</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harenosus: <entryFree id="n20229" type="main" key="ha^re_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aren-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>harena</etym>, <sense id="n20229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sandy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ladon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 7, 4, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus Libyae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 36, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis harenosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 33, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sit harenosissimum subsidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 5, § 20</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hărē-nōsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sandy place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae humi arido atque harenoso gignuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, opp. lutosa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harenula: <entryFree id="n20230" type="main" key="ha^re_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărēnŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">aren-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n20230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fine sand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a grain of sand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
hariola: <entryFree id="n20231" type="main" key="ha^ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. hariolus.</entryFree>
hariolatio: <entryFree id="n20232" type="hapax" key="ha^ri^o^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărĭŏlātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hariolor</etym>, <sense id="n20232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothsaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesying</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> (Fragm. Trag. 42 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
hariolor: <entryFree id="n20233" type="main" key="ha^ri^o^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărĭŏlor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n20233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [hariolus], <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divine.</hi> </sense><sense id="n20233.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <foreign lang="greek">*proqespi/zw</foreign> igitur, non hariolans, ut illa (Cassandra) cui nemo credidit, sed conjectura prospiciens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus causa hariolari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabar, quod dudum scapulae gestibant mihi, Hariolari quae occeperunt sibi esse in mundo malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n20233.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in a bad sense (like vaticinor), <hi rend="ital">to speak foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to talk silly stuff</hi>, <cb n="HARP" /> <hi rend="ital">nonsense</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">age jam cupio, si modo argentum reddat. Sed ego hoc hariolor,</quote> <trans><tr>am dreaming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
hariolus: <entryFree id="n20234" type="main" key="ha^ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărĭŏlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">harĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. hira, entrails; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xordh/, xola/des</foreign>; cf. haruspex</etym>, <sense id="n20234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothsayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetess</hi> (= augur, auspex, haruspex, extispex). </sense><sense id="n20234.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hariolos, haruspices Mitte omnes: quae futura et quae facta, eloquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut haruspices, augures, harioli, vates et conjectores nobis essent colendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n20234.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:95 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 95 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
harmodius: <entryFree id="n20235" type="main" key="Harmo^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Harmŏdĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(armo/dios</foreign>, <sense id="n20235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Athenian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderer of Hipparchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 23, 23, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harmoge: <entryFree id="n20236" type="greek" key="harmo^ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harmŏgē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(rmogh/</foreign>, <sense id="n20236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper combination</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mingling of colors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 5, 11, § 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20236.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">harmony</hi> of sound, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 63:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 63, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harmonia: <entryFree id="n20237" type="greek" key="harmo^ni^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harmŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (archaic <sense id="n20237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> harmoniaï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 131</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(rmoni/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an agreement of sounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consonance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmony;</hi> pure Lat. concentus. </sense><sense id="n20237.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut in cantu et fidibus, quae harmonia dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">harmoniam ex intervallis sonorum nosse possumus: quorum varia compositio etiam harmonias efficit plures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad harmoniam canere mundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeros et geometriam et harmoniam conjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20237.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n20237.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Concord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmony;</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque harmoniā corpus sentire solere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam multum harmoniae Veneris differre videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1248</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20237.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Singing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te nostra, Deus, canit harmonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20238" type="main" key="Harmo^ni^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Harmŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n20238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Mars and Venus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Cadmus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Semele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ino</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Agave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Polydorus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:148" default="NO">148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:159" default="NO">159</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harmonien,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
harmonice: <entryFree id="n20239" type="greek" key="harmo^ni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harmŏnĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(rmonikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n20239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the science of sounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmonics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3, 8</bibl>.— Called <orth extent="full" lang="la">harmŏnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harmonicus: <entryFree id="n20240" type="greek" key="harmo^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harmŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(rmoniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n20240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to agreement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harmony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmonious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmonic</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">harmonica ratio, quae cogit rerum naturam sibi ipsam congruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 109, 113, § 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tinnitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
harpa: <entryFree id="n20241" type="greek" key="harpa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(/rph</foreign> (a sickle, transf.), <sense id="n20241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harp</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Carm. 7, 8, 63.</sense></entryFree>
harpacticon: <entryFree id="n20242" type="spur" key="harpacti^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harpactĭcon</orth>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 176</bibl>; v. 1. harpax.</entryFree>
harpaga: <entryFree id="n20243" type="greek" key="harpa^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harpăga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(rpa/gh</foreign>, <sense id="n20243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hook</hi>, for the usual harpago, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 556, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harpaginetulus: <entryFree id="n20244" type="hapax" key="harpa^gi^ne_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harpăgĭnētŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>harpago</etym>, <sense id="n20244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small hook</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
harpago: <entryFree id="n20245" type="greek" key="harpa^go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harpăgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a(rpa/zw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">aurum mihi intus harpagatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20246" type="greek" key="harpa^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harpăgo</orth> <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a(rpa/gh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hook</hi> for drawing things to one's self, for tearing down any thing, etc., <hi rend="ital">a grappling-hook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grapple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag</hi> (pure Lat. manica, manus ferrea). </sense><sense id="n20246.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 81, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 21</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n20246.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rapacious person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandiloquentulus harpago, mendax, cuppes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
harpagus: <entryFree id="n20247" type="main" key="Harpa^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Harpăgus</orth> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Median nobleman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom Astyages committed his grandson Cyrus to be destroyed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but by whom he was preserved alive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4 sq.</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 3, 15, 1.</sense></entryFree>
harpalus: <entryFree id="n20248" type="main" key="Harpa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Harpălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Cicero's slaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 24, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harpalyce: <entryFree id="n20249" type="main" key="Harpa^ly^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Harpălycē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(arpalu/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n20249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of the Thracian king Harpalycus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brought up as a warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 317</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 193" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:252" default="NO">252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:254" default="NO">254</bibl>. <pb n="841" /> <cb n="HARU" /></sense></entryFree>
harpastum: <entryFree id="n20250" type="greek" key="harpastum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harpastum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(rpasto/n</foreign>, <sense id="n20250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hand-ball</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive harpasta manu pulverulenta rapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:19:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:4" default="NO">7, 67, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harpax: <entryFree id="n20251" type="greek" key="harpax1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harpax</orth>, <itype>ăgis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(/rpac</foreign>, <sense id="n20251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drawing to itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapacious.</hi>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of amber and brimstone: <cit><quote lang="la">in Syria feminas verticillos inde (i. e. ex electro) facere et vocari harpaga, quia folia paleasque et vestium fimbrias rapiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of sulphur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 176</bibl></cit> (the correct reading, see Sillig ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n20252" type="main" key="Harpax2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Harpax</orth>, <itype>ăgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a(/rpac</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n20252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:58 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 58 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 53</bibl> sq. —Also in <hi rend="ital">voc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harpage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
harpe: <entryFree id="n20253" type="greek" key="harpe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">harpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(/rph</foreign>. <sense id="n20253.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sickleshaped sword</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a falchion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cimeter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 663</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:388" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 388</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20253.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A species of falcon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tassel gentle</hi>: Falco gentilis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 74, 95, § 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harpocrates: <entryFree id="n20254" type="main" key="Harpo^cra^te_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Harpŏcrătēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(arpokra/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n20254.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Egyptian god of silence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represented with his finger on his mouth;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">a Greek philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who enjoined silence respecting the nature of the gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 57</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 692</bibl>).—* </sense><sense id="n20254.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a silent person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:74:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 74, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harpyiae: <entryFree id="n20255" type="main" key="Harpy_iae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Harpȳiae</orth> (trisyl.; <sense id="n20255.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">scanned as a quadrisyl. Hārpyĭās,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 1, 608</bibl></cit>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*(/arpuiai</foreign> (qs. the spoilers). </sense><sense id="n20255.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mythical rapacious monsters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half bird and half woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Harpies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:212 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 212 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 289</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:428" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 428</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harpyia Celaeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 365</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n20255.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a rapacious person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a harpy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n20255.3" n="II" level="1"> Also in <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the name of one of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 215</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harudes: <entryFree id="n20256" type="main" key="Haru_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Harūdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n20256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Germanic tribe in the army of Ariovistus</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the same as the Charudes in the Chersonesus Cimbrica</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in the Northern Jütland</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 51, 2</bibl> Monum. Ancyr.</sense></entryFree>
haruga: <entryFree id="n20257" type="main" key="haruga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">haruga</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">harviga</orth>, v. arvix.</entryFree>
harundifer: <entryFree id="n20258" type="main" key="ha^rundi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărundĭfer</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>harundo - fero</etym>, <sense id="n20258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reed-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowned with reeds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:637" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 637</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
harundinaceus: <entryFree id="n20259" type="main" key="ha^rundi^na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărundĭnācĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>harundo</etym>, <sense id="n20259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a reed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
harundinarius: <entryFree id="n20260" type="main" key="ha^rundi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">hărundĭnārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ar-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id. II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n20260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dealer in limed twigs</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
